a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n>Output:		idaho: lowest number of possible customers<n>big city: highest number of possible customers<n>new york: highest number of possible customer<n>shopping mall: medium number of possible customers<n>in town: lowest possible number of customers<n><n>input: which year was gandhi sentenced to imprisonment for a second time? a ) 1922, b ) 1929, c ) 1936, d ) 1938, e ) 1942, f ) 1943, g ) 1944, h ) 1946<n><n>Output: d. He was sentenced to 2nd imprisonment in 1938.<n><n>input: the average age of five friends is 25 years. if p is twice as old as j a and j b are two of the friends. m is 3 times as old as p and m r is six months younger than j. the ages of r, a, b and j are in the ratio of 1, 2, 3 and 4. what is the age of p? a ) 23 years, b ) 28 years, c ) 33 years, d ) 31 years, e ) 13 years, f ) 40 years<n><n>Output: ( m - j ) = ( m * j ) / ( m * p ) = ( p * j ) / ( p - j ) = p - j + p + j = 3 * j a - j + a + j - j = 4 * j d - j + d + j - j = ( 4 * 3 ) - 3 + 4 - 3 + 2 = 13<n><n>input: a certain number of boys and girls were in a school. a group of 30 children were picked up by their class teacher. she picked 10 girls and 4 boys. what is the average number of children picked up? a ) 10.5 b ) 0.5 b )11,5 c ) 12 d ) 9 e ) 16 f ) none of these<n><n>Output: 10.5<n><n>input: how many girls were picked up in the group of 30? a ) 4 b ) 2 c ) 10 d ) 12 e )

a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where could you put a dollar that would make it hard to get out without breaking? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? I'd like a  Glass of milk = a menu item  Explanation: "i asked for'something else' "<n><n>Input:A car starts from rest and accelerates from a speed of 12kmph to a speed of 16kmph. At the end of the time taken to reach 16kmph, the average speed is 14kmph. Find the time taken for the car to reach the speed of 12 kmph. Choices:  A. 5 B. 4 C. 7 D. 6 E.9<n>Output:A: 5 B: 6 C: none of the above!<n>Explanation: "The average speed was 14, but at 16kmph speed the average speed is 32kmph. To solve the equation, divide the 16kmph time by half, and the answer is 4. The time taken for the car in starting from 12kmph was probably when it reached 0 speed, and would take less than half the 5(the 16 speed time was 5 seconds, and 5 divided by 2 gives you 2.5 secs)<n><n>Input:A race of 100 meters took place. Choices:  a: one person starts from 0 meters, the other from 50 meters. b: one person starts from -50 meters and the other from +50 meters.  c: one person starts from +50 meters and other from -50 meters. d: none of the above. <n>  e: they start 10 meters apart.<n>Output:A: b (as per rules, they should start)  B: a then b<n>Explanation: a 100 meter race starts from the starting line and you're not allowed to start from outside. So, the runner who started from -50m wins, as he completed the race faster.<n><n><n><n>

What is John's exact change? Choices: A. $1  B. $0  C. $2  D. $3  E. $4<n>Output: D<n>So the answer will be $3.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>This was a qustion where we are given a string and 2 numbers. The two numbers in total form a pair, the difference between which is 2. So you take pairs of consecutive digits that sum to the desired total, and subtract the pairs from the input string.<n><n>For example:<n><n>```<n>5 6 8<n>9 1 3<n>```<n><n>In this case the sum of the pairs is 13, and they are the desired total. <n><n>### Solution - Part 2<n><n>Given a number, if we want to know if it is prime or not, we will need

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by only a few people recently? Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n>Output:		Cupboard. Since air is recycled, the air you might find in your bedroom is breath that has been recycled a number of times.<n><n>Input: How many days of a 5 - day business trip were spent traveling? Choices: A: 2 B: 1 C: 3 D: 4 E: 5<n>Output: A. In a 5 - day trip, you fly in to a city and fly out in 2 days, leaving 3 days for local travel, leaving a total of 5 days spent (in - flight and local travel)<n><n>Input: How big is the circumference of a honeycomb frame? Choices: A 20 Ï cm B 21 Ï cm C 40 Ï cm D 22 Ï cm E 17 Ï cm<n>Output: As there are 12 honeycombs in a full frame, and it takes 12 Ï cm to complete 1 full circle around the frame, the circumference is 12 Ï ( answer is B)<n><n>Input: A circular garden is to be landscaped. What is the diameter of the garden? Choices: A. 20 m B. 15 m C. 23.3 m D 4 m E 3 m<n>Output: ( Area = Diameter x Diameter / 4 = 2D2 x 1 = 4D2. hence, 3 m)<n><n>Input: Find the surface of a cylinder with the given dimensions and number of circular faces. (Use 2.27 x 10 ^ - 10 for pi.) Choices: A:5.0 x 7.0 B: 16.0 x 20.0 C: 12.5 x 15.0 D: 12.0 x 24.0 E: 15.0 x 35.0<n>Output:( Area of base = Radius x Radius. A = R1 x R1. a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Sometimes it felt like being able to pay bills was the only reason he was actively what? Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n>Output:		" A"<n>So the final answers are a,d<n><n>Input:what is this week about? weigh in on the discussion with a comment below. Choices:  A:( n/a ) B:Ask a question C:Have a suggestion D:Give feedback E:Tell us something<n>Output: "A"<n>So the final anwsers are, a,d<n><n>Comment: I am not sure if I can get an answer for this. But I appreciate your effort.<n><n>Comment: thanks for your cooperation<n><n>Comment: @AakashTikare You may want to take a look at the [tag:multiple-choice] tag which was created recently for this.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? He started learning.<n><n><n>### Instruction:Answer the follow multiple-choice questions.<n><n>Input: a train is running at 16 kmph towards the south and a cyclist is running at 14 kmph towards the north. if after meeting the car, cyclist and train take 6 seconds left in the same direction. in how much time both the cyclist and train reaches to the their destination?<n>Output: Cyclest = 6 +( 5 / 3 )( T +14 ) =136 + 58 => ( 44 + 14 ) second or total time 58 second<n><n><n>### Input: How many square feet are in 10 sq. ft?<n>Output: answer_0 = 1<n><n><n>### INPUT: a circle and a square are lying in a plane such that  each side of the square touches the circle  and the square is in contact with the circle. area of circle/square, in sq. inch.<n><n>OUTPUT: the area of square is 9 and area of circle is 7.85. area of whole shape is 16.85 square feet<n><n><n>### A man starts walking away from a town at 10 kmph. after some time another person starts walking towards the city. the distance between 2 is increasing at the rate of 4 - 5 kmps. a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What appliance uses water and soap? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? Choices:  A: overhead compartment B: chair C: hospital D: in shirt E: business meeting<n>Output:		E<n>So the final answer was E<n><n>## Explanation:<n>#!/bin/bash<n># This is the script to get solution<n><n>echo -e "$(tput setf 9; tput sgr0) \033[1;33mWelcome!!"<n><n>clear<n>cat <<< "$1"<n>echo -e "$1"<n>echo<n>echo -e "$2"<n>echo<n>echo<n>echo -ne "Enter your choice ( A,B,C,D,E or N for next): "<n>read option<n>if [[ $option == "A" ]] ; then<n>	a="option a"<n>elif [[ $option == "B" ]] ; then<n>  	b="option b"<n>elif [[ $options == "C" ]] ; then<n>   	c="option c"<n>elif [[ $operation == "D" ]] ; then<n>    	d="option d"<n>elif [[ $answer == "E" ]] ; then<n>     	e="option e"<n>elif [[ $op == "N" ]] ; then<n> 		echo "Our Job is Done..!"<n> 		echo -e "\033[1mHave a good day\033[0m"<n>    	exit 0<n>else<n>  	echo "Invalid Option..!!!"<n>  	echo -e "\[!] Invalid Option..!!!"<n> 	exit 1<n>fi<n><n><n>if [[ $a == "option a" ]] ; then<n>echo -e "$a"<n>echo "The correct answer is"<n>echo "( A )"<n>echo<n><n>elif [[ $b == "option b" ]] ; then<n> echo -e "$b"<n> echo "The correct answer is ( B )"<n> echo<n><n>elif [[ $c == "option c" ]] ; then<n><n>echo -e "\$c"<n>echo "The Correct Answer is ( C )"<n>echo<n> <n>elif [[ $d == "option d" ]] ; then<n>       echo -e "$d"<n>       echo "The correct answer Is"<n>       echo "( D )"<n>  	   echo<n><n>else<n>     	echo -e "\$e"<n>		echo "The Correct Answer Is"<n>		echo "( E )"<n>		echo<n>fi<n>exit 0<n><n><n>fi<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:i like to examine different things,why do books the chapters on the back Choices:  A: examine thing B: go somewhere C: knit D: read book E: see particular program<n>Output:		C.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? So it must either be the court or dinning room, but the dinning room is more likely.<n>So the final answer to this is Option D<n><n>Input: A rectangular track is to be built along the curved line. The straight part of the track is to be 10 meters longer than the curved part. If the total length of the track is 660 meters. how long is the curved part of the track? a ) 540 m, b )550 m, c )560 m, d e ) None of these â<n>Output: let the curved part be X meters. then, the total length = ( 10 - X ) + ( 10 + X ) = 16X = 660 - X âX = 66 / 16 = 4 m<n><n>So the final answer of this is Option A<n><n>Input: Two cars leave one after the other at the same time. one travels at 60 kmph and the other at 40 kmph. by what time would the faster car have covered twice the distance covered by the slower car? a â )60 mins b â )40 mins c â ) 20 mins d â ) 80 mins e â ) None can be determined â<n>Output: If the distance is 40 and the faster car covers 40 at 60, the slower would have covered 20 at 40 km/hr. 60 - 60 = 0 and 20 + 40 = 80.<n>Time taken would be 90 mins.<n>So the final score is 70 - 30 = 40 - 60(2)<n><n>Input: If 30 is added to one side of a pair of arithmetic sequences, a third sequence of 21 numbers is formed. and if 5 is subtracted from either side of a second pair of arithmetic sequences, the third sequence of 18 numbers is formed. what is the value of the difference between the values of the first term of the two sequences? a ) 4, b ) 8,
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where do kids play with a ball that is concrete? Choices:  A: street B: soccer field C: soccer game D: central park E: pool table<n>Output:		Answer: (E)<n><n>Input: What is the probability that a person who has won an award is an author? Choices: 1) 0.33 2) 0.73 3) 2/3 4) 1/3 5) 2/5<n>Output: Answer: 1) 2/5, 0.4<n><n>Input: At a meeting with other nations to discuss a global crisis, a group of Americans, Canadians, Argentines, Germans, and Swedes are on a committee. How many of the members of the committee belong to countries whose languages are Germanic in origin? Choices: 0) 1 1) 2 2) 3 3) 4 4) 5<n>Output: Answer 1) 2, 0.3333<n><n>Input: Which country is in the Northern Hemisphere and is smaller than Germany? Choices:  South Korea, Japan, Russia and Canada<n>Output: Answer 2) Japan<n>```<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Diving off a cliff for a cartoon character often ends in comedic what? Choices:  A: exhilaration B: dismemberment C: spinal injuries D: getting wet E: splats<n>Output:		I chose: The answer is C.<n><n>Input:In a recent survey, it was found that for every 5 minutes spent on the internet, the number of hours spent reading printed material increased by 8 minutes.<n><n>what is the approximate time in days taken to read a printed book equivalent to watching 2 hours of a television? Choices: A :0.07 B: 0.5 C: 1.44 D: 2.0 E: 3.64<n>Output: I chose the answer A. The answer is C<n><n>Input:What number is 9.5% more than 83? Choices: A: 89 B : 87 C: 97 D: 98 E: 94<n>Output: I did this one wrong! I was looking so hard for a 7 instead of a 5, which is a subtle but large difference!

In that same country, 90% students pass in an examination in<n>  which 25% students got grades which are equal \strong{[removed]} 25 or 30%. This<n>  country has a total of 14000 students. What percentage of the total<n>  student population were in the same exam?<n><n>Output: \strong{[removed] 20% passed and the remaining fail. Now add the passed count to the total count of students. You get the remaining students as fail. So the total percentage of<n>  students who will fail = (100% - 20% = 80% of the students are passed<n>  in exam. so 20% = (80% * 100 = 80% * 20% of the students = 16%).<n>  So total percentage of students who fail = 80% - 16%<n><n>Instruction: Answer the following question.<n><n>Input : In a certain football competition, the scoring system goes as follows: 3 points for a victory, 1 point for a tie, and 0 points for a defeat. Each team plays 20 games. How far<n>  down in the list would the team finishing 20th be if the 20th - placed<n>  team has as many as 372 points?<n><n>Output: Let x represent the total score of any team and we are given y<n>  which represent the 20th ranked team has 372 points. x = y + 1.<n>  x + 5y = 196(the total points in the last 20 places) Divide both sides<n>  by x and we get x = 5y/. Now what is the 20th place? we
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What is a sign that you might not be living soon? Choices:  A: growing older B: reproducing C: shuddering D: perspiration E: palpitations<n>Output:		"during this period, i am getting older. i can have children soon. so answer is B"<n>So the final output is B<n><n>Input:Which of the following is not a sign that you might be living soon? Choose: A: shuddering B: reproducing C  palpitations D: perspirationE: growing older<n>Output:E  so the final output is E<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where is a note likely to indicate a melody? Choices:  A: fridge B: a classroom C: envelope D: medical chart E: sheet music<n>Output:		Answer : A<n>Input: In a tournament each player plays the others once. At least 13 games must be played to ensure that every player plays 2 games with each of the 10 other players. How many players are there in the tournament?<n><n>Output:Answer : 13 and 9<n>Input: What is the largest number of points that can be scored by two different numbers while playing the game of Nim? Choices: 22 24 20 32 30<n>Output:Answer: 20<n>Input: What year was the first Super Bowl played in, assuming we skip the 1970's?<n>Output:Answer :1970<n>Input: If A > B, is B > A impossible, true or false?<n>Output:Answer: True<n>Input: How did the U. S. Census Bureau count the population of the nation in 1790?<n>Output:Answer Choices:  by sending census takers to each home<n> by sending questionnaires to all homes<n> by using taxpayers' checks to cross-reference home addresses with bank records<n> by using the census to assign a home's address to a neighborhood  Answer : by using the census toassign a home's addressto a neighborhood.<n>Input: A bag containing red, blue, and purple balls is mixed together and then poured out onto a table. What is the probability that one ball chosen at random will be blue?<n>Output:Answer 1111<n>Input: At a party, Alice and Betty are wearing shirts with animals on them which begin with the same letter. Alice is wearing a bear shirt, Betty is wearing a bull shirt, and 3 others are wearing shir<n>Output:Answer : I<n>Input: Are these two statements equivalent: (1) the sum of the squares of the integers from 1 through 10 is a perfect square, and (2) the sum of the integers from 4 through 14 is a perfect square? Choices: Yes<n>No No<n>Not Enough Information<n>Answer :No<n>Input: What was the year that John Dunn was on leave from the U. S. Congress?<n>Output:Answer Answer :Dunn was on leave from U. S. Congress from 1913 to 1919<n>Input: Which of these is
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:what can years of playing tennis lead to? Choices:  A: tennis elbow B: proffesional player C: exercise D: victory E: becoming tired<n>Output:		"a) tennis elbow, b) professional player, c) exercise,d) victory, e) becoming tired, so answer is B"<n>So the final ans is b. answer: b<n><n>Input:A group of 6 people can complete a certain gardening job in 20 hours. If one person joins the group, how many hours does it take to complete the job?A:3 hoursB:4 hoursC:6 hoursD:7 hoursE:9 hours<n>Output:"C"<n>A group of 6 can complete in 20 hours therefore it will take 3 hour for each person to do whole 20 hour job. One more person of 7 hour will just make it more than 20 hour, so the answer is C.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n>Output:		"Answer = A. A bee hive does not always have a queen. Only if it is part of an organized colony will it have a queen. Queens may also "abdicate" their role within the hive. Therefore, if an occupied bee hive is not part of an organized colomy, it doesn't have a queen. However, a queenless hive may produce a queen who becomes the new queen.<n>"So let's not get too technical, even an organized colony of bees that does not have a current queen may have a queen in the future.<n>"A. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What place is not interesting to children? Choices:  A: classroom B: toy store C: school D: soccer game E: dinner<n>Output:		A<n>So the final answer to the question of "What place is not interesting for me?" is answer: A.<n><n>Input: a student is asked to write the first 20 prime numbers. which of the following is not a correct method of counting the prime numbers? a ) from 2 to 20, b ) from 2 to infinity, c ) going down to infinity, d ) going down to 20, e) going up to infinity<n>Output: "prime numbers is starting with any number, 1 is not prime, answer for this question."<n>So the answer for the question of: "which of the following is not correct method for counting prime numbers. a ) from 2 until 20, b) from 2 until infinity, c ) going to negative infinity, d ) going to 20, and e going to +" is answer c<n><n>Input: if a 2 - digit number is divided up to its units place, the remainder is 2. what is the number? a ) 18, b ) 21, c ) 15, d ) 92, e ) 99<n>Output: "answer = c, which i got is 15 because 15 is the remainder ( 99 / 3 ) = ( 50 * 59 ) / 3 so the answer is c "<n>So the final answer in this case is c.<n><n>Input: the cost of 9 bottles of wine to the customer is the same as the cost of 6 bottles of wine to a manufacturer while the cost of 3 bottles of wine to him is two and a half times the cost of 1 bottle. the cost of making 9 bottles of 1 / t c of wine is the same as the sale price of 6 bottles in rupees and the cost of making 3 bottles of 15 / 2 c of wine is 4 time the sale price of 4 bottles in rupee. what is the sale price of 1 bottle of 15 / t c of wine in rupees? a ) 64, b ), c ) 56, d ) 7, e ) none of the above<n>Output: 15 / 15 c = 2 c ; 9 bottles of the 2 c = ( 2.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What do rich people like in terms of bagels? Choices:  A: poor B: sleepy C: plain D: needy E: homeless<n>Output:		A : needy<n><n>Input:A tiger runs 40 feet in 1.5 seconds<n>Output:48 feet per second<n><n>Input:a certain type of computer has been sold for $1000 in 1991, 950 in 1982 and $1659 in 1975. what average annual decline has there been in the price of the computer during the last 20 years? a ) 7 %, b ) 4 %, c ) 5 %, d ) 10 %, e ) none of the above<n>Output:9 %. because 950 - 1000 / 100 * 20 = < 1 % hence average annual decline = ((0.8 ) * 20) / 100 = 9 %<n>So the final answer should be 9 %<n><n>Input: how many liters of 60 % v / v sulphuric acid ( h 2 so / 2 ) must be added to make a 2 % v / v solution? a ) 125 liters,  b ) 375 liters, c ) nl, d ) 122 1/4 liters, e ) none of  these,<n>Output:172 1/4  liters.<n><n>Input: at every minute after 1 o 'clock in the afternoon, another person joins a queue of 8 persons. how many persons are there in the queue after 1 minute 50 seconds? a ) 3, b ) 5, c ) 12, d ) 49, e ) none of this<n>Output: 50 = > 1 + 50 = > min + 8 people = >28<n>Answer is b<n><n>Input: a shopkeeper has a total of Rs 220 to invest in three types of shares : A, B and C. he invests 1 / 3 of the total in shares A. he is able to save 5 % more from each of the three shares when he invests in them in a ratio of 2 : 3 : 5. find the total amount invested by him in a share? a ) Rs 160, b ) Rs 195, c ) Rs

a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What might a person receive from their boss if they do a poor job? Choices:  A: misfortune B: fearful C: criticism D: make mistakes E: promotion appraisal<n>Output:		"I think boss will say something like "do this again and you will be fired""<n><n>## Instructed (again)<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good.  Where might they be installed? [ 1000 x x ] = 1 / x = 1000 / 92. 7 = 10. 68 x =  10. 6<n>So the value will be c<n><n>Input: if A  = 3 B  = 2 C  = 1 D  = 20 / 3  = 4 / 3 and E  > D, which of the following is true? a ) A, B, C and D are all integers. b ) D is a perfect square. c ) D is an irrational number, but not an imaginary number. d ) E is a rational number, but not an integer. e ) E is a real number but neither an integer nor a fraction.<n>Output:"D is > D, D is an irrationa  number but not an imaginary. the answer is d."<n>So the final answer for this question is D<n><n>Input: a = 5 a b = 10 a c = 7 a f = 10 b x = 1. 75 a n = 10 c d = 0. 0077456<n>Output: "so answer is e"<n>So the final possible answer choice here for this question is e<n><n>

a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where is a paper notice likely to be left on a house? Choices:  A: front door B: conference C: classroom D: refrigerator E: suitcase<n>Output:		Choice D answers.<n>So the final answer should be D.<n><n>Input:Where are pigeons likely to congregate during the day? Choices:  B: conference room C: kitchen D: playground E: park<n>Output:Choice B answers.<n>So the correct answer should be B.<n><n>Input:I was able to catch a lot of fish at the creek that runs between the two hills that we saw yesterday. Choices:  A : between C : in front B : in and C: near of D: from between<n>Output:Choice B Answers.<n>So the final Answer should be B.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? Each square is numbered on a chess board from 1 to 64 to identify the square on the board.<n>A numbering system is used to identify the piece in the square. For example, a rook in square e1 is identified as the kingâs rook and a rook in e8 is identified as the queenâs rook.<n>A king is not allowed to move into check or capture from any of the 64 squares from the board.<n>The basic moves in a game of chess are : Pawn : A player may move the pawn in any one move diagonally forward from its opening rank. A pawn is considered to have reached the opposite rank.<n>A player must move a pawn to a higher Rank unless it is already in a higher rank. A pawn moved into such a new rank must be used for the capture of an opponent pawn.<n>It is not allowed to recapture. A pawn may move as far as across the board. It can occupy the rank immediately in front of it.<n>The pawn may be moved to any open square in its starting Rank except the first rank.<n>It can be moved to the 8th rank and be promoted to a Queen, Knight, Bishop or Rook.<n>The Knight : When
