### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What happens when someone is playing too aggressively? Choices:  A: get hungry B: laughter C: injury D: having fun E: feeling happy<n>Output:		<n>Ans.<n>a - hungry ---------------------------->  hungry ( b ) laughter ---------------------------->  the person laughing feels good ( c ) injury ---------------------------->  can be a funny memory ( d ) having fun ---------------------------->  fun  ( e ) feeling happy ---------------------------->  feeling happy <n>So the final answer that is having having fun is d<n><n>Input:If she is a student, she does not work anymore. But if she is not a student, then she can work.<n>Output:a<n>So the final answer student<n><n>Input:I go home when the sun sets.<n>Output:Home<n>So the final answer home<n><n>Input:There is an 85% chance of rain.<n>Output:85%<n>So the final answer will be 85<n><n>Input:If it rains, it is going to be muddy.<n>Output:Muddy<n>So the final answer muddy<n><n>Input:I saw a kangaroo today.<n>Output:Australia<n>So the final answer Australia<n><n>Input:I am doing research now.<n>Output:Research<n>So the final answer Research<n><n>Input:We are having a good time on vacation.<n>Output:Vacation<n>So the final answer Vacation<n><n>Input:I went to the grocery.<n>Output:Grocery<n>So the final answer Grocery<n><n>Input:I play volleyball every day.<n>Output:Volleyball<n>So the final answer volleyball<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What are students trying to do? Choices:  A: necklace B: wall outlet fixture C: tool box D: computer E: motorcycle<n>Output:		If I screw a chainring onto something I will change the size or gear it will have to move forwards. You can put a ring into a wall outlet but you can put a ring onto the chain of a bicycle.<n>Sol:<n>If I screw a ring onto something, it will be something round. I can screw a ring into a necklace or onto the chain of a motorcycle.<n>I cannot screw a circle onto something as circles arenât shaped like rings.<n>I cannot scramble a ring onto something unless I remove it from one surface onto another.<n>I cannot scrabble something onto something unless it fits.<n>I cannot scrawl something onto something unless I move it from one surface to another.<n>I cannot scroll something onto something unless it has an arrow.<n>I cannot scuttle something onto something unless I remove something else.<n>I can squeeze something onto something as long as it has room. I can squeeze toothpaste onto a toothbrush but I canât squeeze toast onto a toothbrushing machine.<n>I can sway a ring onto something as long as I donât remove something else.<n>Solution Verified by: Pooja Bhardwaj<n>So the final answer was B<n><n>Input: in the given figure, we have to find how many rectangles will fit in the given area. A: 6, B: 7, C: 4<n>Output: "the area of the circle will be 540. if we consider x rectangles, each rectangle will have x * 540 as area. then sum of the area of all rectangles will be 54*x. 126 has the most area per rectangle( area > 54*number of rectangles) 4 has the least area per rectangle( 4 has twice the area of the smallest rectangle. 7 rectangles have a sum area of 2982. 7 is the answer"<n>So the final answers were D and E respectively as option C is not the answer because 5 rectangle fits in the area<n><n>Input: Which one among the following pairs is in correct order? a ) Z : b. 44 64 b ) Y 3 : Z 62 d<n>Output: "Y 17 is 3 times greater than Z (
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where would you put a dictionary while you're using it? Choices:  A: library B: study area C: table D: classroom E: shelf<n>Output:		A<n>So the final answer should be A<n><n>Input: The next day's weather forecast predicts rain. When should I bring my umbrella? A) Anytime B) In the morning C) In the afternoon D) In the evening<n>Output: It is a random question and depends upon weather in your city<n>So the final answer: Anytime or In the morning<n><n>Input: Find the volume of an isosceles trapezoid with base length of 30ft and height of 6ft. Choices: A: 10ft^3 B: 20ft^3 C: 30ft^3 D: 100ft^3<n>Output: 20ftÂ³<n>So the final answer be 20ftÂ³
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:A common saying, Sam thought, was to go forth, also this. Choices:  A: reverse B: backwards C: back and D: back and E: tally back<n>Output:		the answer is C<n><n>Input:What do you say, sir? The boy asked. Choices: A: I beg to inform B: I beg pardon C: I beg your pardon D: I beg your pardons E: I beg of your pardon F: I beg to inform you G: You are hereby notified<n>Output:the answer is F<n><n>Input:What news? I say, the girl asked Choices: A: Good evening B: The news is C: I don't recognize D: I do not know E: Good day F: How are you<n>Output:the answer i F
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? Choices:  A: alert B: deep sleep C: drink coffee D: open eyes E: conscious<n>Output:		A<n><n>#### Instruction:<n><n>The following are real sets of measurements from a population of 1418 students who took an Intellimetric Test in elementary school. The mean score of the mathematics questions was 54.9 while the mean score of the reading questions is 28.6. a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where would you find some swords in your house? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Bill did not abandon the fight, but did what to the enemy? Choices:  A: arrogate B: retain C: embrace D: smile E: engage<n>Output:		"C -- embrace"<n><n>Input:Alice gave me two different pieces of cake. How many pieces of cake did I get? How much is Aliceâs share? Choices: A: 0, B: 2, C: 4, D: 6, E: 8<n>Output: "E - 8 pieces of cake. Share: 2 ( A + D ) = 10 = > share is A + D = 6 + D = E"<n><n><n>## How to solve: Multiple choice question<n><n>We have two options: ( A+E ) and (B+1), if answer is A, then E must be B or else (B+x) will not be option. If A is option then E must also be option. But x is not a option, hence, B+1 will be option <n><n>For multiple choice question, after finding the solution if all the possible options are not same then take any option and subtract E and put it as x

a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What do humans do when in a race? Choices:  A: lay eggs B: eat fruit C: wrestle D: compete with each other E: draw pictures<n>Output:		"A is the correct answer. we will give the right answer and we will also say why that answer is correct"<n>So the final output answer is that "A" is correct<n><n>---<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The garage had light sensors and automatic doors, what kind of house was it? Choices:  A: modern house B: building C: townhouse D: neighbor's house E: downtown<n>Output:		"a"<n>So the final decision is a<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Lindy was a senior. E."<n>Output:" Where are you going?"<n>So the final ans  are  B or C<n><n>### Instruction:1.Write a program that can convert a fraction into a set of words.<n><n>Input:5 / 8 ( fraction )<n>Output:  in  /  8  ( words ) <n>So the final ans is D.<n><n>######Instruction: <n>1.The method should take two arguments. The first argument should pass the fraction as a string ( eg 5 / 8 = "5  / 8" ). The second argument should be the choice of the desired representation of the fraction ( option from below ). This will be the order of the final results of the fraction ( eg the above example is "5  / , 8 " as we passed 5 / 8 as an argument)<n><n>A.as a numerator and denominator separated by a slash.<n>B.As a set of words ( e.g. 5  / 8 = " in  / 8 " )<n>1.You can choose B for all the numbers less than one as we cant divide by 0.<n>	<n>C.As a sum of numbers that are both positive or both
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What could be happening near you if the ground is getting wet? Choices:  A: solidifying B: melting C: getting cold D: feeling cold E: skin rash<n>Output:		"The answer is D. the wet surface is not because of water it is because of an oily film due to hydrophobicity phenomenon. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:How can buildings like the Empire State building be described? Choices:  A: small B: underground C: high D: huge E: tall<n>Output:		A, since they can't get higher than the clouds.<n><n>Input:The number of people who go to the mall on Tuesday is a small fraction of the number of people who go on Friday.<n>Output: A, since there is a clear distinction in numbers on Tuesdays and Fridays.<n><n>Input:There is strong empirical evidence that one can get more people to like the taste of beets by giving them to people who hate beets.<n>Output: B, because beets taste disgusting.<n><n>Input:If the number of members of the baseball team is an odd number, there is a strong chance that the person throwing the baseball at that time is either the pitcher or the catcher.<n>Output: E, because this is impossible given odd number of team members.<n><n>Input:It is harder to do the same task with fewer people.<n>Outpt:E, because it is easier to do a bigger task with less people
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The rowdy frat boys shouted they would have fun and do what tonight? Choices:  A: do enjoy B: get laid C: enjoyable D: work less E: enjoy living<n>Output:		A: do enjoy<n>So the final answer for the above question is A<n><n>Input: the score in an indoor game of table tennis is the same whether players serve or not. 55 games were played. 55 games in which the losing player scored more than the winning player constitute 10 % of the games. calculate the overall score of the winning player. a ) 985, b ) 982, c ) 973, d ) 49, e ) none of the above<n>Output: "let the overall score be a. score for player1 = a - b ( win ) = 55 / ( 100 - p ) - x ( lose ) = 55 * ( 100 / 100 - x / ( 10 + 2 * x ) ) = 55. x = 5 + 2 ( 55 ) / a = 88 games. hence a = 985."<n>So the the final answer for the given question is a

Choices:  E: Mass Effect 2 F: Deus Ex: Human Revolution G: Dragon Age: Origins H: Bioshock Infinite<n>Output: "Deus Ex: Human Revolution = G, Mass Effect 2 = E, Bioshock Increment = H, Dragon Age: Origins = F answer : C "<n>So the final answers will be C and B<n><n>Input:Which of these is NOT a type of wizard or sorcerer? Cat and dog 0.75 + 0.92 = 1.67 %. answer : 3."<n>So the final answer will all be 3<n><n>Input:If you have an inverter to take off-grid, it makes sense to install solar panels so you can generate your own power, right? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The old barn was beyond repair, they had to destroy it before they could what a new one? Choices:  A: make B: raise C: entice D: build E: fix<n>Output:		"after getting an option i thought and then i got the answer by eliminating all options b,c,d because we cannot make anything new from nothing. only option a. so option a is the correct answer"<n>So the final outcome is a<n><n>Input:"A certain number b divides a number n. if the sum of n and b is n then which of the following cannot be n? 1 ) 10, 2 ) 14, 3 ) 19, 4 ) 20, 5 ) 32 " (10 / 4 ) % 9 = 3 / 4. (4 * 4 ) / 9 = 1 / 4 = 14 % 9 = 7 / 4. 20 / 3 = 7 /3. 32 // 2 = 16 /2 = 16 % 9 = 14. so the answer is b and c"<n>So the answer is b andc<n><n>Input:"a certain number x divides 178. if the remainder 14 after dividing 178 / x is twice the remainder of 143 / y, what does x divide? A) 14 B) 143 C) 43 D) 95 E) 132 "x ( 143 ) / 178 = 23 x ( 43 ) / 95 = ( 23 / 23 ) ( 43 / 95 ) = 1 and 43 / 171 = 1 and 132 / 178 is 7 so its answer is none"<n>So the answer it none.<n><n>Input:In a 4 way simultaneous movement, the position-time graph is a straight line. But in a three-way simultaneous movement, the line is a curve. Why?<n>Output:Straight line is a best fit for 4 ways simultaneous movement but curve for 3 ways simultaneous movement<n>So the answer is C.<n><n>Input:Six times a digit is greater than three times the same digit. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:How does a flea locomote? Choices:  A: attack B: suck blood C: stay D: lay eggs E: jump<n>Output:		"a flea move by jumping"<n>So the final choice is E ->  E<n><n>Input:how many 3s are there in the number 47379853? a ) 30, b ) 28, c ) 19, d ) 23, e ) 9<n>Output: "since a number have only 10 digits then there are only ten places in number. number of three in number is : ( 3 * 10 ) - ( 3 - 3 ) = 10 - 1 = 9 "<n>So the final choice has an answer as 9.<n><n>Input: what is the sum of all digits in 3488? a ) 24, b ) 26, c ) 16, d ) 14, e ) 28<n>Output: "sum of all the digit = sum of digit of each positions i.e. ( 3 + 4 + 8 + 8 ) = 24"<n>So final answer is b<n><n>Input:if 5 is subtracted from the square of the number 61 which yields a palindrome, what is the number whose square yields itself? a ) 44, b ) 99, c ) 70, d ) 45, e ) 66<n>Output: "let the no ( n ) be the number whose square gives a palindrome. 5 - ( 61 x 61 ) = 44. square of no is 44 "<n>So final answer is a<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? Of those who have never been to college 12 are men. Of those who have been to college 6 are women. What is the total number of teachers in the school?<n>Output: Let n= the no. of teachers A= the no. of the teachers who have never been to collage, and B= the no. of women teachers T= the no. of TOTAL teachers ( n+b) = 53*15/100 => n+b = 116.5 4b= 31*16/100 => b = 24.5 A + B + B = 116 => B = 0.96 B = 96 => (n+B) = 116=> A = 12 So the total no. of teachers in the school = 12+96= 108 So the final answer is B.<n><n>Input: A group of hikers decided to stop for lunch. Since they are all hungry, it was decided that when everyone has found a good place to sit, we divide into two groups to search for food and drink. Each group meets at the same place when it finds something good to eat. The hikers agree to start looking with an equal chance of finding it first. How can they ensure that they will meet at the same place no matter where they stop?<n>Output: When the number of hikers is odd then there should be an even number of people in each group so that there will always be an odd number of hikers in one group and an even number of hikers remaining in the other group since two hikers equal to the size of one group can move together to the next resting point. So the number of hikersts in each group should be equal to the odd numbers.<n>If the number of Hikers is even then there should always be an odd number (1) of people in one group and an odd number (2) of people in the other. This is because 1 + 1 + 1 = 3 is odd and 0 + 1 + 2 = 3 is

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Output:		"he was bad at traditional science and good at social science. his favorite subject is none of these. the right answer is E"<n>So the final response is E<n></p></div></body></html>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? Choices:  L: Coffee shop, A: Reception, B: Conference room, D: Parking lot, E: Copy room, F: Bathrooms<n>Output: B<n><n>Input: How many students are members of the Beta club in this school? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:If you aren't experiencing curiosity and want to ensure viewing enjoyment, what may you watch? Choices:  A: examine thing B: stare into a mirror C: go somewhere D: hear news E: see favorite show<n>Output:		A) If your not experiencing curiosity then you can't make viewing choice.<n>B) If your are experiencing curiosity, you can't watch yourself in the mirror as that will not be interesting or exciting.<n>C) If you are not curiosity you will not likely go somewhere, go somewhere is a curiosity based activity.<n>Hence D) If you are curiosity, and you can't hear a news, you may watch your favorite show. Hence A is correct choice.<n><n>Input: 5*2-3*4+3-5+3*8-9 / 9-7+2 is what percent of 10*9+6? The answer is A) 14% B)23% C) 35% D) 0.5333<n>Output: 5*2 = 10 5*3 = 15 5*4 = 20 5*8 = 40 5*9 = 45 No of terms = 5 45 = 28 So 5*28 = 140 So 89% is the answer.<n><n>Input: I want to know what the answer to "What is the most common color of eyes in America?" is. <n><n>Output: The answer is green.<n><n>Input: Is it true that the answer to the puzzle "Why is 6 afraid of 7?" is 8? <n><n>Output: Yes.<n><n>Input: When it is 7:30 a.m. at the North Pole, it is: A) 7:30 p.m. at the Equator B) 2:30 p. m. at Giza, Egypt C) 10:00 p.m. in China D) 4:30 p.mi. at my house<n>Output: B. It is 7:31am at the Equator.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The gambler had been winning a lot, he wisely decided to what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What does a person looking for new things in life do? Choices:  A: become depressed B: welcome change C: thank god D: experiences E: pay bills<n>Output:		"If you are looking for change then welcome it. don't try to hide it."<n>So the answer is C<n>    <n>### Input:Answer the following questions.<n><n>The number of words which come under the category of the given word list can be represented by the number 2 to the power of that number, followed by the alphabet C in which the alphabet C in the end will be replaced by 2 to and the alphabet X which will be left of will be given after the alphabet C to produce number which represent number of words in the list. Output:  How many words will come under the category 'flood' if the alphabet 'flood' is given. <n>Output:4F if the alphabet X is given as O.<n>Output: If P is replaced by the letter U. How many words will come up in the category "Pen"<n>Answer: 52<n> <n> <n> <n> Output: "How many letters will come in the category "Education" <n>if X is put in the place of U?"
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where would you put a handle if you want to bring it with you? Choices:  A: briefcase B: coffee cup C: carry object D: frying pan E: on a hat<n>Output:		A = briefcase B = coffee cup C = carry object D = frying pan E = on a hat<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>Input: A family of four is driving across country. Their car only has 15 gallons of gas. They only stop at gas stations where 3 of their 4 family members (all 4 of the family members are different people, so it's okay if a spouse drives the car, etc.) can pull up the gas pumps. Each pump has a limit on how many gallons each of the family members can pump (3 gallon limit, except for the oldest child, which has a 5 gallon limit). How many gallons of gas does the car have after everyone pumps?a. 31  b. 10  c. 29<n>Output: C = 29<n><n>Answer: B<n><n>Input: A man is riding a bus and has $1. He offers a ride from the bus driver who is driving from a point $3a1/2$ away from the bus. The man drives to 3/4 distance from bus point and then he offers ride to bus driver. The bus driver accepts. How much money is in the man's hand now?a. $2.5 $ b. $4$ c. $2$ d. $1.75$ <n><n>Answer: C<n><n>Input: A ballerina has 4 pairs of shoes. Each pair of shoes weighs 390 grams, and each shoe is labeled with a small tag, which weighs 0.5 grams. If the ballerina has 22 pairs of shoes total, how much will her dress weigh?a. 305 grams b. 345 grams c. 380 grams d. 8400 grams  e. 10290 <n>Output: C =  8400
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What do you need to have before buying products? Choices:  A: desire B: spending money C: money D: needs E: time<n>Output:		<n>A, and D.<n>So the final answer A and D<n><n>Input:Whether you need to look at the price? Choices: 1 <n>A: desire D: needs <n>B: spending money C:\ E: time<n>So the final answers A, and D<n><n>Input:"If you could have more than one of the things you want? Choices: A, B, C, D<n><n>So the final answer all four of them<n><n>Input:"In the end, you get what you want?" Choices: <n>A.<n>B.<n><n>C.<n><n>D.<n><n>So the final answed all of them.<n>"If you could have more things than one of the things," So you get all of them. <n>Instruction: Answer the following short answer question
