### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:When I was home, I was comfortable.  But I had a crippling fear of going where? Choices:  A: outside B: vacation C: idle D: apartment E: neighborhood<n>Output:		A: outside<n>So the final answer to this question is A<n><n>Input:If I could pick just one food to eat every day for the rest of my life, I'd pick A: salad.  B: lasagna.  C: mashed potatoes.  D: bacon.  E: cereal.<n>Output: E: cereal<n>So the final answer for this question is E<n><n>Input:At what time was it four hours before 9 P.M.? Choices: 1: 1:30 P.M. 2: 5:30 P. 3: 10:30 A.M. 4: 8:30 P.A. 5: 7:30 P. M.<n>Output: 4: 8.30 pm<n>So the correct answer for the question is 4<n><n>Input:Which of these groups is correct? Choices: 7: 30: 00: 00 A: A.M.  B: P.M.  C: 12: 00 noon D: 1: 00: midnight E: 12: noon: 12: midnight<n>Output: E<n>So the right answer for the question is E<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where will a native lemur be found? Choices:  A: india B: hole C: cage D: habitat E: rain forest<n>Output:		"the native lemur is indian lemon so our answer is A : india"<n>So the final solution is a<n><n>Input:"Find a number which is divisible by 7 and 11, but not divisible by 13." So, Choices:  A : 49 B : 29 C : 3 D : 91 E: 1007<n>Output:"49 is divisible by 11 as well as 7 but it is not divisible by 3, so answer is C : 29"<n>So the final Solution is c<n><n>Input:"How much petrol is needed to fill a motor car with a fuel tanker, when the fuel tanker was full to the top, that is, when the height of the fuel tanker with petrol is h metres?" So, Choices: A : 12 h B:13 h, C:h-13 D:h+13 E:27h<n>Output:"the motor car tank is h-13, so the answer is B : 13 h"<n>So the final Solutions is B<n><n>Input:"how much does an apple weigh?" So choices : A: kg B::10 Kg C: 100 g D:20g E: 200g<n>Output:"the apple weighs 100g, it is in group C."<n>So the final solutionis C<n><n>Input:"in a class of twenty-five students, 22 can speak german, 13 can speak japanese and 20 can speak both german and japanese. in a certain school assembly, 8 students speak germank, 3 students speak japanese an 2 students speak both german and japonese.  how many students speak neither japanese nor german?" So choices: A : 1 B : 2 C : 3 D: 1 E : None<n>Output: "there are two students from class who don't speak german and japan, they are in choice D or E"<n>So the final answers are D or E<n><n>Input:Find a number which is not a factor of 100. So choices: A: 2 B:4 C:5 D:12 E:None of these<n>Output:2 is not a factor
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where can you eat fruit on a red bridge? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: engineering school C: san francisco D: tree E: market<n>Output:		"The bridge name is San Francisco and it is RedBridge. So A B C D E are correct options"<n>So the final answers are A and B and C and D<n><n>Input:A man in a row boat attempts to cross a river of width 50 m. the velocity of the current is 16 kmph. the man can row at 7 kmph in the still water. how much time will it take him to cross the river?<n>Output: 50(16 - 7) / 49 + 7 = 937 / 7 = 133.14285714285 secs.<n><n>Input: a boy has to cross a bridge. It is a one-way bridge and he has only 3 minutes to cross the bridge. What is the minimum time the boy must spend to cross the bridge if he must not turn around?<n>Output: 1 + 1 / 3 + 1 /... + 1 /. N = 3N * Min(3N, 3/2) = 9N = 9.<n><n>Input: "This is my first solution :<n><n>Choose the one letter that best completes the series. GHJKLM<n>GHJKLM<n>N_P_Q_R_S___<n>N_P_R_S__O_T____<n>O_P_R__T_V_W___<n>___U_G_V_W_X___<n>___U_V_X____<n>____W____<n>____Y____<n>"answer is X"<n><n>Input:"This is my 2nd solution:<n><n>Choose the letter shown in capital letters. KMNOP<n>KMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ<n>N__P__Q___R___S_____<n>____T_____U______<n>____V_____W____<n>____X____Y_____Z______<n>____Y_____"answer is M"<n><n>Input:"The next solution:<n><n>Chooses the letter shown in capital. AZXCD<n>ANZXCD<n>BRFLGZO<n>CFDKQVRX<n>GKQVWXG<n>KTQWXZS<n>XCVFW<n>_____Z_____"answer is Z"<n><n>Input: A

a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where in your entrance hall can you keep you head wear? Choices:  A: school B: large home C: house D: hat rack E: closet<n>Output:		'A' A.S.K. H.E.L.P for all things UPSC<n><n>Input: what is the length of a rectangle with a perimeter of 60 cm and width of 12 cm? a ) 12 cm, b ) 16 cm, c ) 20 cm, d ) 24 cm, e ) none of the above<n>Output: "let the length be x. then x + 2 x = 60 ( = length + 2 width ) = length + width = 60 - 12.. x = 48 x = 12 answer : a"<n>

C is the last letter of last alphabet in that set . B is the second letter from last in that set . C is the sum of the letters of that set . the last letter of that alphabet is .<n>Output: answer : e  so answer is d<n><n><n>####<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What makes people happy when it is surprising and unexpected? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? I'm not sure I completely understand the question.<n><n>Comment: A programming language is the language that the machine understands, for example C, Java, and Python. What you have is probably an "interpreter". So yes, "The program that writes the program that writes the program" is an interpreter, not a language.<n><n>Comment: It's a script that runs in *interpreter*.<n><n>Comment: I think you guys gotta stop downvoting and pointing out it's off topic (it's not), just tell the guy what he is asking for in your own question.<n><n>Comment<n><n>Sorry I don't quite clearly state what I need to know. What is it called?<n>Is the code I have written above is an interpreter of a programming language or a tool to write a small program/programs? What is the difference?<n>Or what is the difference between the two.<n><n>Is the code I've written below is an interpreter of a language or a tiny or small program of a programming language?<n><n>Answer: You haven't specified the language, but the code you show is probably Python.<n><n>I guess it's an interpreter because it doesn't seem to store any data and it's designed to run (interpret) text.<n><n>There are other languages that are similar, like ruby or perl.  As far as I know there are no languages that use this syntax and are not an interpreter.<n><n>Answer: You have created a code interpreter.<n><n>Interpreters exist for a variety of programming languages, including languages like Python that have their own [standard library](http://docs.python.org/library/) and standard [API](http://docs.pylonsql.com/en/latest/index.html) for writing additions to Python.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:They launch a surprise attack, this ended the what? Choices:  A: surrender B: defence C: retreat D: cease fire E: defend<n>Output:		The letter is A<n>So the answer is A<n><n>Input:Find the largest 2 digit no in a clockwise. Choices:  A10 B11 C12 D13 E14 <n>Output: The answer is B<n>So the answer is B<n><n>Input: How many squares are there in 6x6x6?<n>Input: 1. You are given a 3-digit number with no leading 0. You are also given a 2-digit number. Let's call it num. For example, if num=5, N=3, then N = num-1 = 4. Now, I will provide you with 3 different 3-digit numbers, which you will compare to the original 3-digit input. What is the probability that the first digit of input is greater than the first digit of the 3 numbers provided? i.e. are there more chances of input having 3 > 2 > 1 in the first 99 places, or 2 > 2 > 3 < 1?<n>Output: a) If the first digit of the input number is greater than the first digits of the three numbers provided, then the answer is A b) If the first digit is equal to the first digits of the given numbers, then the answer is B c) If the first digit input number is lesser than the first digit of any of the three numbers provided then the answer is C<n>so the answer is A<n>Input: 2.  Given two lists a and b, a is sorted and b is not sorted. You have access to a sorting algorithm, the same one used for the interviews. What is the probability of at most 1 swap between a and b in 4 steps?<n>Output: Let the steps of sorting be A[i] < A[j]. Swaps can occur at any of these places. Now the number of positions where A[i] < B[j] and B[j] < A[i] are same in A and B are N. Swaps will be performed and all the positions in A and B where N will be different will have to undergo at least one swap. Hence at most N swaps will be required. The answer is B<n>Input: 3. Given an array, can you write a function which will give you the index of the first occurrence of a number in the array?<n>Output
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What European country is famous for its potato industry? Choices:  A: idaho B: casserole C: new hampshire D: root cellar E: ireland<n>Output:		Explanation: idaho is in North America (USA). casserole, new hampshire, and root cellar are in North America (USA) or Canada. So, there's no European country. Ireland (located in Europe) is known for its beef industry.<n>Answer: A<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Dancing for a long time will lead you to become what? Choices:  A: sore B: intercourse C: fatigue D: become tired E: expression<n>Output:		"Dancing for a long period of time will lead you to have exhaustion/become tired."<n>So the final answer can be d<n><n>Input:"Follow me" are ___ sentences. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What gets rid of a mundane routine? Choices:  A: sophisticated B: imprevist C: arcane D: heavenly E: new<n>Output:		A) Sophisticated<n>So the final answer I<n><n>Input:The biggest is the king? Choices: 0: Agree 1: Disagree<n>Output: <n>So the final answer Y<n><n>Input:I am the one who likes to go far Choices: 0...0<n>Output: <n>I am the one who loves far away things. So the answer is far.<n><n><n>-1)Input: 2 < 3<n>Output:<n>-2)Input: 3 > 5<n>Output:<n>-3)Input: 6>?<n>Output:<n>-4)Input: 5 < 4<n>Output:<n>-5)Input: 3>4?<n>Output:<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:There was a saucepan used only for marinara, where was it kept? Choices:  A: georgia B: the south pole C: kitchen cupboard D: italian restaurant E: boil eggs<n>Output:		georgia, as "marinara is a sauce from marinara, which is a cheese and tomato based sauce originating from the greek island of marinara"<n><n>#### Input:There was a saucer of water, how deep was it? Choices A: 5 inches B: 9 yards C: 20 centimeters D: 30 feet E: 54 inches<n>Output: C 20 centimeter<n><n>#### Input:In a soccer game there are two teams, "Team A" and "Team B". ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:If people are vegetarian, what do they do more of? Choices:  A: believe in god B: sun themselves C: eat hamburgers D: gain wealth E: eat plants<n>Output:		A<n>So the final answer should be A<n><n>Input:the length of a rectangle is 15 centimetres. what % of its breadth is it? a ) 15 %, b ) 20 %, c ) 27 %, d ) 33 %, e ) none of the above<n>Output: "the length of a rectangle = 15cm. it's breadth = 15% of its length = ( 15 / 100 * 15cm ) = 1.5cm only. that's not a percentage, so answer is "e"."<n>So the final answer for this question should be "E"<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the last question please.<n><n>Input: In a certain competition every team plays exactly 2 matches and there are 12 teams taking part in the tournament. a team which has lost all its matches is eligible for a prize if it scores more goals in total than any other team. if an equal number of goals are scored by the winning teams, what is the maximum prize money a losing team can receive? a ) â¹1,30,000,b ) â¹1,00,000 ,c ) â¹50,000<n>,d ) â¹45,000 <n>Output: " 12 teams. each team play 2 matches. 12 X 2 = 24 matches. a total of 4 teams won all their matches. each winning team plays 2 matches with other teams. a total of 8 matches. a total of 16 matches. ( 4 + 8 ). 4 teams draw all their matches, so each draws 2 matches with each other. ( 4 X 2 ). a total of 6 matches. hence the losing teams play 4 matches. ( because only 4 teams lost ) a total of 8 matches. if a losing team plays well and gets 6 goals, rest 16 teams gets 4 goals together. so losing team wins the prize. hence it gets â¹ 45000. answer: d. "<n>So the final answer would be D.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:After the guilty verdict in the killing the judge gave a speech, he told the murderer he was pure what? Choices:  A: wrong B: death of C: bad D: negative E: evil<n>Output:		after the murderer was found guilty, the judge said, "you are pure evil."<n>So the final answer was E<n><n>Input: what can you find at both ends of a tunnel? Choices:  B: new york A: the west E: the east<n>Output: I live in New York.<n>So the final choice was B<n><n>Input: what time do you get up in the morning? " It asks, "how old are you?" " are" is not in lower case.<n><n>Input: 1. what are you doing? 2. who is doing it? Choices:  a: you are in new york city b: ross is doing it c: alex is doing it d: i am doing it e: it is being done by alice<n>Output: You are doing it. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n>Output:		Answer: D - The word ârevolutionâ comes to us from the French word ârvolutionâ and French historians trace it back to an old French word ârecuperaâ which referred to the reformation of property owners to their rights. So technically, a revolution is when property owners, aka âthe peopleâ change society and establish new rulers who are responsible for the betterment of the people (property). It is not something we strive for. It is not an end to itself. It is not something we seek to build upon through political action. It is not even a fight for liberation as revolution is about liberating oneâs self by restoring or attainment of oneâs rights. A revolution is a change in the direction of power, a change in the form of government, a revolt, even. Now that the French Revolution has been discussed, it is important to know that a revolt can refer to a mutiny, insurrection, rebellion, uprising, revolt, revolution, and even a civil war. It is a revolt against some government authority, the ruling class, and even against a foreign government.<n>So in other words, a civil war, a rebellion, an insurrection, even an uprising can all be considered a revolution.<n><n>Input:What are the three most major religions? Choices: <n>A: Judaism, Islam, and Christianity B: Christianity, Islam, and Hinduism C: Islam, Christianity, and Judaism D: Hinduism, Buddhism, and Christianity E: Christianity, Judaism, and Baha'i<n>Output:Answer: a - Judaism, Islam and Christianity are the three major religions in the world.<n><n>Input:If you were born in Canada in the 1950s and 60s and never traveled much, where did you go on your vacation? Choices: A: Vancouver B: Quebec C: Calgary D:Toronto E: Regina <n>Output:Answer: B - If you did go in the 60s and not in the 50s, you went on vacation to Quebec.<n><n>Input:Which are the countries located in Eurasia? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? Choices:  [A] Parasitic [B] Asexual [C] Herbivorous [D] Omnivorous [E] Terrestrial<n>Output: "Parasitic is a type of organisms because they feed on host animals"<n>So the final ansewer is b (parasitic )<n><n>Input:Choose the word with different meaning from the rest : Choices:  [1] Different [2] Fiery [3] Sweater [4] Piggy [5] Scent<n>Output: "Scent - a sweet smell in the air"<n>So the final answe is 1 (different )<n><n>Input:What is a carnivore? Choices:  Carnivore - is a mammal that eats only meat Carnivore - a mammal that is found in warm places Carnivore - any other animals that are not herbivore and omnivore Carnivore - an animal that eats plants and meat any other animals that are only herbivore Carnivores - an animal that has 3 - 5 legs<n>Output: "Carnivores - A mammal that eates only meat"<n>So the final answered is b.<n><n>Input: Find which of the following is not a living thing: Choices:  [3] Tree [4] Table [5] Computer [6] Desk [7] Alive<n>Output: "Alive is a living thing"<n>So the finalanswer is 3<n><n>Input: Which plant produces fruit? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Someone who doesn't care about about someone else and wishes them to fail has what feeling towards them? Choices:  A: unfeeling B: negligence C: antipathy D: indifferent E: rapport<n>Output:		Answer is E.Rapport=the act or quality of rapport.<n>so the final answer of this question is E.<n><n>Input:An unpleasent expression on Johnâs face made me so nervous that I couldnât ______ a word. a ) speak b ) say c ) talk d ) shout e ) laugh<n>Output:answer is c.<n>So the final answer of this quastion is c.<n><n>Input:Sheâs the daughter of my grandpaâs brother. a ) Sheâs my grandmotherâs granddaughter. b ) Her grandpaâs granddaughters are my great grandmothers. c ) Sheâs my motherâs motherâs younger sisterâs daughter. d ) Sheâs her motherâs younger sister. e ) My grandpaâs grandson is my motherâs mother.<n>Output:answer is e.<n>1.Her grandpaâs grandchildren are our great grandmothers, her grandpaâs daughterâs children are our grandmothers,her grandpaâs daughter is the mother of the grandmothers,She's her motherâs fatherâs daughter.Sheâs her motherâ son.So,Sheâs my motherââs motherâs granddaugheter.<n>So,the final answer is e.<n><n>Input:Why donât you go and see Bill instead of Bob? a ) Bill is the next person in the line. b ) I donât like Bob. I like Bill better. c ) Bill is not as handy as Bob. d ) Bob did the job. You did not. e ) My mother wanted me to see Bill after lunch.<n>Output:answer. is e.<n>1)I like bOb better,Bob didthe job.( I like bobbetter,I like bobbetter)<n>2)You did not do the job. I did.(Youdidnâtdo the job.I did)<n>3)I wantto talk to Bill first.(I want to talk to bill first)<n>4)I have never met John before. a ) I had been waiting for him. b ) This is the first time I have met him. c ) I hope to meet him. d ) I know his brother. e ) I had come to see him.<n>So the finalanswer
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What does reckless driving lead to on a person? Choices:  A: injuries B: fatigue C: traffic jams D: tired E: accidents<n>Output:		B.

a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? Cargo can include both liquids and dry goods. Cargo ships typically have a very large capacity and can be very large. Freight ships transport dry goods, liquids, and perishable goods such as food. There are many different types of cargo ships. For example, there are container ships, bulk carriers, car carriers, and tankers."<n><n>So the final answer should be "B"<n><n>Input:Many aircraft are undergoing maintenance after a certain number of flight hours are completed. Choices:  A) pilot B) airplane C) air hostess D) tire E) plane<n>Output: "C- air hostess : Air hostesses are the onboard staff of the aircraft, also recognized as stewards and air stewardesses. Air hostesses are present on all the sectors of commercial aircraft as part of the crew. They have the important responsibilities on the ground and flight duties aboard the airliner."<n><n>So the actual answer is "C"<n><n>Input: Many of the large aircrafts of a certain airline have undergone refurbishment. Choices: A: cargo B: engines C: tires D: planes E: pilots<n> Output: "B - engines : Engines are machines that transform thermal energy into kinetic energy, generally acting against the force of gravity to propel or overcome a resistance to motion."<n><n>So the answer should be "B".<n><n>Input: Many people take an elevator or an escalator to go up or down in a shopping mall. Choices: A : stairs B : staircase C: escalator E : elevator D : elevators<n> Output: "A - stairs : A staircase is usually the narrow passage between a room that is located in a higher level and another room that is in the lower level. Every staircase has a wide, broad, or deep set of stairs. We often use stairs for traveling from one level to another. It is designed to reach any place above or below in a building."<n><n>So the correct answer should be "A".

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:An attempt to confirm an applicant's reference would fail if the reference does what? Choices:  A: question B: dispute C: deny D: contradict E: refuse<n>Output:		I'm going to go with A (confirm)<n>So the final answer should be A<n><n>Input:A certain company issued a contract calling for a 2-year commitment. After 1 year and 3 months, the company cancels the contract. What is the amount of damages to which the contractor is entitled for breach of contract? A) $16,000 B) $40,000 C) $60,000 D) $100,000 E) $139,000 <br> Solution: A is 40k<br> This is how I set-up the equation. First, we need to find out the time in years for a month. 4 divided by 3 = 1.33, 10 divided by 3 =3, 5 divided by 3 =1.666, 7 divided by 3 =2.333. So one month equals.666666. There are 13.33 months in 1 year. So that's 13 years 3 months in one year. Then we can simply multiply the amount of damages by that number. So $405000 13.3 = $40,032,300. So final answer will be (A)$40,003,230.<n><n>Input: The difference between $P(1.08\hat{~}) â $P(0.33\hat{~}) + $P(0.12\hat{~}) is A).0033 B).0315 C).2632 D).5174 E).7701 <br> Solution: D is the answer<n><n>Input: A man purchases 100 items for $225. This is an example of A) a discount. B) cost averaging. C) an increase. D) a decrease. <br> Solution: B is the answer. Cost average is averaging something where the cost per product changes<n><n>Input: A) +910 C) -60 D) +90 E) -61 <br> Solution:: A is the answer, +910 = 91
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Everybody raised a drink and cheered, they were doing what? Choices:  A: were thirsty B: toasting C: getting drunk D: refreshment E: celebrating<n>Output:		A: were thirst, B: toasting, D: refreshment, E: celebrating<n>So the final answer set is A, B, D, E.<n><n>Input: Everybody raised a drink and...<n>Output: Cheers!<n><n>Input: Everyboy raised a drink and... (a toast)<n>Output: Cheers! (a toast) (or any combination of A, B, D and E)<n><n>Input: Everyone raised a drink...<n>Output: Cheers!!!<n><n>Input: Everyboddy raised a drink...<n>Output: Cheers!!! (or any combination of all three solutions A, B and D)<n>

Questions type MC : Questions type with a minimum of 3 and maximum of 6 correct questions <n>2.  Questions type SS : Questions type with minimum of 5 and maximum of 24 correct questions <n>3. Questions type DD : Question type of just 1 correct answer
