"<n>So the answe is 10,5<n><n>Input: a rectangle has an area of 167 square inches. one side is 5 inches more than twice 1/4 of the shorter side. what is the perimeter of the rectangle? a. 29 in., b. 30 in., c
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where would you store a shopping bag if all the seats in your vehicle are full? Choices:  A: the roof B: storage cabinet C: car trunk D: retail store E: home<n>Output:		C answer is C<n><n>Input: Which of the following do not fall under "general misconduct"?<n><n>Choices:<n>A: Theft<n>B: Lying<n>C: Punching a coworker<n>D: Using work computer to stream porn<n><n>Output: D choice is D<n><n><n>Input: What are the three largest land masses?<n><n>Choices: <n>A: North America, Europe, Asia<n>B: North America, South America, Africa<n>C: North America, South South America, Africa<n>D: Europe, Asia, Australia<n><n>Output: B choice is B<n><n>Input: Which is not one of the 10 characteristics of "fascist regimes"?<n><n>Challenges to the status quo,<n>Dictatorship of one strong man,<n>Protectionism,<n>Lack of human rights,<n>Hatred of opponents,<n>Rejection of equality,<n>Mix of the religious and political<n><n>Output: E choice is E<n><n>Input:Which of the following things about the Great Barrier Reef are not always true?<n><n>There is little sunlight because of the clear water below,<n>The only animals seen by divers are small creatures such as fish.<n>It is a protected ecosystem and divers must follow park rules when visiting.<n>There are lots of sharks, particularly white-tip sharks, as well as sea snakes.<n>It is very popular with SCUBA divers and snorkelers.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What city in the middle east is known for a temple? Choices:  A: jerusalem B: texas C: middle east D: china E: india<n>Output:		I was wrong<n><n>Input:How many people are attending the party: 1 5 4 2 3 3<n>Output: 1 <n><n>Input:The word "fruit" is hidden in the phrase: "a piece of cake with raspberry and coconut cream"<n>Output: Raspberry Coconut cream - - - - - --- - - - - - Fruit<n><n>Input:Who is the CEO of Apple: Steve Jobs Steve Ballmer Steve Cook Eric Schmidt<n>Output: "apple = a - m - l - e. apple has CEO Steve jobs, apple = apple jobs. answer : a"
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What do people do to pass time before they can use electronics when fly in airplane? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where is a good place to sore a wind instrument in you home? Choices:  A: under bed B: symphony C: music room D: band practice E: music store<n>Output:		Answer is symphony<n><n>Input: the area of a rectangle is 1796 sq feet. the other sides of the rectangle are 1/20 th of this area. what are the side lengths of the rectangle? a ) 54 ft, b ) 58 ft, c ) 80 ft, d ) 83 ft, e ) 63 ft<n>Output:  "1/20 * 1796 = 948 sq ft. side = 1/4 * 948 = 235 ft "<n>So the final answer 235 ft<n><n>Input: what fraction of a week is three days? Choices: A: 3/5s B: 2/5s C: 1/5s D: 2/5 E: 3/5<n>Output: Answer is C<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question: What is the median of the list of numbers 45,85,83,53,75,93,78. A). B). C). D).  E).<n><n>Output: Answer is 53<n><n>Input: what is the sum of 6, 8, 8, 9, 8, 6, 9, 9, 6,6,6,6  A). B), C), D).  E ).<n>output:  Answer is 446<n><n>Input: a group of 10 is made with 4 boys and 6 girls. is this an odd or an even group? Choices: A) Even B) Odd C) Cannot determine D) Not possible E) None of these<n>output: Answer is A<n><n>INPUT: If 3/5, 5/7, 3/7, 5/9 are in AP, what is the value of 6 /11<n> output :  Answer is 2 /9<n><n>INPUT: What is the least possible value of 14/x?<n> output : Answer is 0.12<n><n>INPUT: How many people voted for each candidate? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:To what part of your home is your morning paper delivered? Choices:  A: classroom B: synagogue C: bathroom D: front porch E: grocery store<n>Output:		To what part of your home does your a morning paper delivered? a ) a, b ) b, c ) c, d ) d, e ) d<n>a paper is delivered to synagogue hence the answer is b<n><n>Input:In a certain game, a player loses points for his wrong answers and the loser's score is the number of points remaining at the end of the game. a game in which 1 points is lost to every false answer, 4 points are won for every true answer and 3 points are lost for every wrong answer is played as given : a player has 75 points. the number of true answers he gives is? a ) 10, b ) 11, c ) 12, d ) 13, e ) 5<n>Output: "if a player has 72 points and he loses 2 points for every wrong answer the number of wrong answer will be 32 hence the points left are 40. if he wins 3 points for every right answer the points left will be 4 now his right answer are left the points left are 38. hence the answer is c"<n><n>Input: How many letters in the word TACO are vowels? a ) 4, b ) 3, c ) 2, d ) 2, e ) none of theea ) 4, b<n>Output: "we start from the beginning and after "TA" there is a "C" and "O". from each of them there is a letter like "E". then in remaining "O" "A" can also be used. hence the answer is d"<n>So the final letter is d.<n><n>Input: The answer is correct!!<n>Output: "answer is correct ( yes )"<n>So the final sentence is yes.<n><n>Input: Sorry, i made a mistake this time.<n>Output: "answer was wrong ( no )"<n>So the error is no.<n><n>Input: A: I like this word! B: I do not like this word either!<n>Output: "the answer is d none of them like the word"<n>So the answer is none of them like the answer.<n><n>Input: Please do not answer my questions.<n>Output: "the question must be answer. the answer is a "<n>So the answer is a as the question must be answer.<n><n>Input :I

a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:He had been doing favors for everybody at work, it was frustrating not getting any what for it? To work without intervals B. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The family was playing cards, what would be a reason for this? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What does moving cars entail? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where would you find a binder containing homework assignments? Choices:  A: backpack B: bookcase C: office supply store D: office E: class room<n>Output:		A:<n>So the final answer id A.<n><n>Input: What color is the shirt that you're wearing? Choices:  a: Blue B: Pink C: Green D: Yellow E: White<n>Output:B:<n>So the final answe r is B.<n><n>Input:Where is your wallet? Choices:  Backpack Backpack Pocket Purse Pocket<n>Output : Pocket Pocket<n>So the final answehr is Pocket.<n><n>Input:Whose shirt do you wash in the morning? Choices:A: Your mom B: Your dog C: Your dog B: D: Your sister<n>Output : B:<n>So the final answers is back of the test paper.<n><n>input:The shirt you are wearing is a blue _____. Choices: T-shirt Polo shirt Jacket Sweater Pullover<n>Output: T - shirt<n>So the final answer will be T - shirt only.<n><n>input:Where do you take your books to be graded? Choices: A: School book store B: School C: Library D: Book store near your home School C:<n>So the final anser will be School C.<n><n>input:How much money do you get from completing 100 puzzles? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Shane was supposed to speak at his fathers funeral.  He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n>Output:		The word they are looking for is a comedic.  The question makes mention of Shane appearing "ridiculous" which I feel is something to be looked at in a comedy aspect.  They wanted it to be compete because they wanted a good laugh.  I think the word "comedic" is a compete word with a good laugh! :)<n><n>Input:What was the population of New York City in 1800?<n>Output: 15,646 <n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? They edit it down to just ten seconds. They take 16 photos of a baby. They edit the 16 down to 2 photos.<n>I'm given two numbers. Both are bigger than 1. (For example, if my first number is 17, my second number might be 24. If the first number is 18, my second number may be 20.)<n>One of the numbers I can use in the second set of numbers in any way I like. For example, I could take the first number and add it to the second number so I have a bigger number to work with.<n>The second number in the 2nd set of numbers is always larger than the 1st number in the first set of numbers.<n>I can use the second number in the second set in any way I like to help me solve for the first number. I don't just have to keep making it bigger and bigger.<n>Find the first number in the first set.<n>Answer: The answer choice is A, since the second number in set 2 will always be larger than the first number in set 1. The problem statement will not tell you if you will be adding the two numbers together or not, and because of this, we need to pick an answer choice that does not require us to do that. I picked A (Easier), since the second number in this case is going to be the 1st number minus the 2nd number in the set 1, but I believe you could solve this problem with C (Easier), also.<n><n>The problem states that "One of the numbers I CAN USE IN THE SECOND SET OF NUMBERS IN ANY WAY I LIKE." (Capitalized by me to make it more obvious). We are given the first (smaller) number in set 1, and a range (2 numbers) of numbers that are in range of the first. Then it states "

Choices:  A: rain forest B: research laboratory C: cage D: treetops E: south africa<n>Output:		Choices given : A : Rain forest ( 1.3 LTR ) B : Research laboratory ( 2.3 LTR ) C : Cage ( 1.3 ) D :  Treetops ( 1LTR ) E : South africa ( 0.9 LTR )<n><n>In this question the answer is given as Option C, which have 1.3 Ltr. 1.3 LITRE = 1.3L = 1300CC<n>So final answer is C<n><n>Input:The word "CERAMICS" is made up of 22 letters. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What could you put a table in if you want the table to be in your house? Choices:  A: library B: demonstration C: corner D: football ground E: rug<n>Output:		"different people see table in different ways. likewise, there are many different meanings of the english phrase " table corner ". which one to use depends on user. in this case, english is not a fixed and rigid language. user is supposed to use the most appropriate phrase. if you can, provide the option d with the word corner in the options so that they are not forced to pick from the list. i have provided a similar type of options to another question with this problem and got the answer which was d. i have modified your data so that the answer for this problem is d."<n>So the final answer for this question is d<n><n>Input: What could you put a desk in if you want the desk to be in your house? Choices: A: corner B: footstool C: library D: rug E: garden<n>Output: "d different people see corner in different ways. like, which one to use depends upon user. in this case, englih is not a fixed language. user is supposed, according to the context, to use the most appropriate phase. so providing a phrase containing'corner'in the list would leave user no choice but to pick that from a list. and the answer would be d. i would provide this answer to another question with this same problem but with the phrase'desk corner'and got this answer. i have modified ur data so that the answer to this problem is d."<n>So the answer to this question is d<n>##<n><n>#!/usr/bin/env ruby<n><n>puts "Hello World"<n><n>input_question_1     = {<n>    :question => "Input:Answer the following multiple-choice question.\n\nInput: in a recent hand to hand runoff election, 1200 casted votes out of which 1/6th of the votes were thrown out and 2/5th of the remaining votes were casted for candidate A. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:John is studying animals.   What is one of the many things he has to watch them doing? Choices:  A: bathe B: bite C: die of cancer D: obesity E: copulate<n>Output:		C<n>So the final answer (one of the many things he must watch is copulate, and the correct option is C)<n><n>Input:The teacher wants to divide her class in 3 groups : those who know more than 100 countries, those who know less than 100 but more than 50 countries and those who don't know a single country of the world.What is the largest group of those who cannot spell their own last name? Choices:   A: B : D: E : F:<n>Output:A<n>So the final answer group B.<n><n>Input: 50% of 35 is how much percent of 18? a ) 28.5 b ) 33.5 c ) 17.5 d ) 20 e ) none of these <n>Output: "a ) 50% of ( 35 + 50 + 25 + 10 ) = 55. 55 is 17.5% of 325 answer : a"<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>The data is provided in columns. Each column contains two or more numbers separated by commas.<n><n><n>Output:<n><n>Input:<n>    4,4<n>    77,87<n>    4,5<n>Output:<n>    131<n>Input:<n>    19, <n>    78,<n>    28,<n>    12,<n>    38<n>Output:<n>    21,<n>    29,<n>    86<n><n>

That meant that the only time to leave was when? Choices:  A: early morning B: day time C: night D: afternoon E: daytime<n>Output:		"answer is option E. because Sarah had been home all evening that means she must have been home in the day time. since there is a difference of time there we can select the answer according to the time difference. in this case time difference is day time - i.e - afternoon to days so the answer option is D."<n>So the final answer E<n><n>Input: In a certain family, each one of 5 grand children eats either yogurt or bread. 3 of them eat both and 2 of them eat only yogurt. how many grand<n>children does the family have?  a ) 5, b ) 4, c ) 3, d ) 2, e ) 1<n>Output: "If there are 2 who eats yogurt only, then the number must be odd. Let the grand parents be X. Then X(X-1)/2 = 2. Which reduces to 2X = 3. If X = 2 then the total number of grand children must<n>be 3. If X is one more, then the total grandchildren must be 4. So it must be 3."<n>So the final answers are e.<n><n>Input: there are 7 boys and 8 girls  on the floor of a building.  what is the chance of selecting a student of one gender and another of opposite gender?? a ) 1 / 8 * 49 / 49, b ) 1 / 7 * 1 / 8, c ) 1 / 49 * 50 / 49, d ) 1 / 2 * 49 /<n>49, e ) 49 / 85<n>Output: "Let the floor  be F and  G. ( As in the floor of a building ) If G and F is in that case we get the answer. If FG is in then all are boys.( 9 of 15) If FG is not in, in that case we get ( 5 of 15)( 6 of 15 ) as our answer.<n>Hence both the scenario has same probability. Hence, answer is "E "."<n>So the final ans is e<n><n>Input: In how many ways can the letters of the English  alphabet be arranged in  three - letter  words  ? a )  47, b )  6, c )

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What do only some types of police do? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The child really wanted to teach his grandpa to read, he thought it was wrong that he had spent his whole life what? Choices:  A: ignore B: write C: learn new things D: illiterate E: having fun<n>Output:		The child really wanted to teach to read, he thought that it was wrong that he has spent whole his life ignorance. Choices: A: illiterate B: write C: ignore D: learn E: having fun<n>So the answer is a<n><n>#!/bin/bash echo 'input :'$@ echo 'program :'$? echo ''<n><n>for i in $@<n>;;<n>do read array[$i];<n>done<n>if {[ ${#array} -gt 0 ]};<n>then {<n>echo "${!~#array[@]}"<n>}else{<n>echo "${!array[@]}"<n>}; fi<n>echo ''<n>

a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Lizards need the sun's heat to regulate their body temperature, this is why you'll see them still on what? Choices:  A: bushes B: dessert C: books D: heat lamps E: rocks<n>Output:		(Lizards need the ) (suns heat) to regulate their (body ) (temperature)<n>This is why you'll (regulate body ) temperature = Regulate body<n>This is why youâll (regulate body) temperature = regulate body<n>This is while you'll (regualte body) temperature regulate body<n>this is why you should (regulate body) (temperature)<n>therefore the answer is a ) b ) c ) d ) E F<n><n># Instruction:<n>Create a new word from the given characters. Words are considered unique i.e. once they are created, they cannot be changed.<n><n>Input: "jacquelinej"<n>Output: "jacqueleneljacquelinejacquelenel"<n><n>Input: "hellohello"<n>Output: "hellonoo"<n><n>Input: ""<n>Output: "hello"<n><n>Input: """"""<n>Output: "world"<n><n>Input: ["Hello"],<n>Output: "Hello"<n><n>input: "appleorangecandlecar"<n>output: "appelenoconcandlecarcandlestars"
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What would a person do if he or she wanted to get good grades? Choices:  A: feel proud B: try to learn C: need assistance D: thank god E: read alot<n>Output:		The correct answer is "a"<n><n>Input:Choices: 1): If an individual is being asked how many children does she have, she will say two.<n>2): If a person is asked how many students does he have, he will say one.<n>3): If an individual's being asked how many years he has been teaching in this school, he will say fifteen.<n>4): If someone's being asked for how many years he has worked in this company, he will say seven.<n>Which one of the statements is true?<n>Answer: 3. This person has been a teacher for fifteen years.<n>The statement 1) and 4) can both be true if the individual is asked about the number of years he has worked in different companies and how many total years he has worked in the current job. But when being asked how many years has he been teaching in this school alone, the most plausible answer will be answered as 1). We know that there are companies that require teachers and other non-teaching staff, and they each have a different tenure for which they were hired. Most likely in other companies the person works there for 1 year before moving to another company. Hence 1) is more plausible.<n><n>### Instruction 2:<n><n>Input:Choose one of the answers that represents the best answer to the question or complete the sentence in a way that best answers the question.<n><n>What is an important part of the sentence, "Sara is 5 years old?"<n>A)She is 5<n>B)Sara is 4<n>C)She is<n>Only sentence B can be the correct answer. If Sara is 5, she would be less than 5. That makes the next birthday the 6th birthday, which makes Sara 6. This is what gives Sara the title "5 years old"<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What can happen in your mind while sleeping? Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n>Output:		"i think option A might happen because we all do that while sleeping."<n>So the final answer option A might happen because that's something that happens in real life, since we all do that.<n><n>Input: Choices:  1) 50% for those below 18 2) 30% for those above 30 3) 30%<n>Output: 1) is incorrect because it is the probability of something happening. We can only use odd numbers because something must happen. 2) is incorrect because it says 30% for 2 or fewer people. 3) is the best option because 50% of something is always the same as 2 or fewer, but the chance for both happens.<n>So the final answer 50% of those below 18 is correct<n><n>Input: Choice:2. 1) C 2) A 3) B<n>Output: 15 is added to 20. 20 is then doubled and both numbers together would get you 60 so that is the answer.<n>So the final Answer is 40<n><n>Input: Choose option: 2. A 3) 223 4) 1 5) 231 2) 1. 3) 5) 4) 2 ) 3 5) 1<n>Output: 14 is added to 32. 32 is then doubled to 64 and both numbers together would give you 168 so that is the answer<n>So the final Answer option ( 1) is correct<n><n>Input question: What is 1/2 of 1/3 of 1/4 of 60? Answer : 6 (1/2 is not simplified, so is 1/6 * 1/3 *1/4, which equals 6/216, where 1/2 * 1/3 = 1/6 and 1/2 *1/4 = 1/12 )<n>So the final answer which is 6 is the right answer.<n><n>## Instruction: Answer the following multiple choice questions<n><n>Input question: 21 Ã· 4 (1/4 = 0.25) = 4 (21 * 0.25 = 5.25
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What preposition do you use if you want to combine two words? Choices:  A: article B: adjective C: interjection D: conjunction E: pronoun<n>Output:		"a, article"<n>So the final answers is A<n><n>Input: how is the function of an antibody different from that of an antigen? Choices:  A : an antibody recognizes and then kills antigen B: an antibody identifies and then neutralizes an antigen C: an antibody binds to an antigen D: an antibody is a product of an antigen E: an antibody and an antigen are components of a T cell<n>Output: "b, antibody and antigen are two different components present in an immunity system, an antibody identifys antigen. antibody binds with antigen and neutralize it, antibody is produced as a response to antigen hence d."<n>So the final answer b <n><n>Input: What is the number of 4 - digit numbers the number 8438 can be divisible by? Choices:  ( i ) 1 ( ii ) 2 ( iii ) 3 ( iv ) 5  (v) 4<n>Output: "iii 8438 when divided by 4 leaves a remainder of 2, but a remainder of 2 2 can only be obtained when the number is divisible by 4 hence ii or iii "<n>So the final answer iii<n><n>Input: If the letters A, B, C, D, E, and F are a code word for a five - digit number, then the word that represents the number eight - hundred and ten thousand is ( 5 ) : ( i ) FCDBA ( ii ) DFEBCA ( iii ) CEDBAA ( iv ) ABCDEF<n>Output: " ( v ) 5 is not possible it will give a incorrect number and ( iv ) the answer is ( iii ) Cedbaa "<n>So the final answers iii<n><n>Input : what are the four steps involved in the process of plant nutrition? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b?
