### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What do you need to run after ball? Choices:  A: get tired B: have legs C: skip D: not fat E: look first<n>Output:		"we need legs to run."<n><n>Input:How many years did King Arthur rule? Choices: <n>Output: "47. i guess."<n><n>Input:A man is trying to run out to second base but fails. He says to himself, "Darn - next time i'll run out faster!" For example, if he says the second quote 250 times, how far off of the base will he be after he made the mistake the final 250th time? Choices: F: 3 feet E: 250 feet C: 28 feet G: 2500 feet B: 0<n>Output: "(250 * 3 ) + x = 1000 ==> x = 625 <n>So the final answer will be c"<n><n>Input:The ratio of children born in 1996 to 2000 is n : 24 : 41 : x Choices: <n><n>Output: "n : 24 : x : 41 ==> x = 24 * 4 ==> x = 1247 <n>So the final figure will be d"<n><n>Input:If my sister is older than me by x years and my mother is older than me by y years, how old is my father? Choices:  E: 2 * y - x<n>B: y - x<n>F: 2 y - x<n>A: y + x<n>C: y-x<n><n>Output: "my father is E : 23y - 10x = 43 ==> my father is 133 <n>So the answer will be F"<n><n>Input:When i went in a math test,i started to cry,but then i said"ok,I can do this".After finishing my test,i was so happy that i ran 50 yards!How many yards faster did i run after i told myself"ok,I cando this"?Choices: E: 100 yards<n>G: 50 yards<n>F: 25 yards<n>B: 75 yards<n>A: 50 yards <n><n>Output: "[6 ( 50 / 10 ) ] = 30 ==> i ran 30 yards after telling myself OK"<n>So the final answers will be G<n><n>Input
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where could you find some airplanes that are not being used? Choices:  A: war B: aircraft carrier C: sky D: graveyard E: crash<n>Output:		<n>So the final answer<n><n>Input:In which of these 4 countries do you find less than half the population under 20 and more than half the population over 50? A: United States B: Japan C: India D: China <n>Output:A. This is the correct answer.<n><n>Input:A pizza costs $14.95. On this pizza there are 10 slices. How many slices cost $3?<n>Output:10/3*14.95=4.99 rounded up this would be 4.99.<n><n>Input:Find the product and the quotient of the sequence: 6, 24, 72,<n>Output: Product- 144 Quotient - 24<n><n>Input:What is the last digit of the largest prime number between 123 and 164?<n>Output:4<n><n>Input:The length of a rectangle is x + 5 and its width is 2x - 3. Find the perimeter of the rectangle.<n>Output:8x-7	  <n><n>Input:What number should go here to make 50% of the sum of 14 and 80?<n>Output:20<n><n><n><n>#### 1.<n>Input:How many times is the given expression equal to three times itself?<n>Output:None<n><n>#### 2.<n>Input:What time of the day is it if it is?<n>Output:None of these<n><n>#### 3.<n>Input:If you were to add the digits of the temperature today (in degrees Fahrenheit) and then subtract that sum from the digits of the temperature tomorrow (in degrees Fahrenheight), which digit will remain and which digit will vanish?<n>Output:The answer is: 9 <n><n><n><n>#### Part 2<n><n>##### Question 1:<n>Input:On a particular date, in the evening of June 2nd, 2009, 81500500 meters of ice melted in the Arctic Sea. When did this melting start?<n>Output:None
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:She was processing the wool, she kept her leg bouncing to operate the what? Choices:  A: hospital bed B: legroom C: spinning wheel D: grand piano E: rhythm<n>Output:		B. Legroom.<n>So, the final answer is B

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where do you buy treats for kids over a counter? Choices:  A: candy store B: butcher shop C: kitchen D: auto repair shop E: post office<n>Output:		Choice D - Auto repair shop kids under a certain age are not allowed in a post office but they can be in an auto repair shop.<n>So the final answer was choice D<n><n>Input: 2 / 3 * 4 + 1 / 3 / 5 * 3 =?<n><n>Output: 3 0.9 * 4 + 0.3 * 3 = 2.7 + 0.9 = 3.6<n>So the final answer has to be c<n><n>Input: If 25 people walk into a mall, does the number of people increase or decrease?<n><n>Output: Decreases, the amount of people coming will be the same as the amount leaving.<n>So the final question is option C<n><n>Input: Where do you buy treats over a counter for all?  Choices: 1: candy store, 2: butcher shop, 3: grocery store, 4: kitchen, 5: auto repair shop <n>Output: Choice 5 would be the answer since all means they're all ages.<n><n>Input: What is the biggest number that can fit under the 8th letter of this sentence? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? Choices:  A: loss of consciousness B: relaxation C: snoring D: dreaming E: talking<n>Output:		A(1)<n>Answer: D(2)<n>So the final answer in D.<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The boy was too nervous to dance, so what was he doing progressively at the ball? Choices:  A: dance like crazy B: standing still C: wallflower D: stand still E: like dancing<n>Output:		B: standing still. So the answer is B.<n><n>Input: a book contains 17.2 % of poetry, 15.3 % of science and the rest as prose. if a book contains 200 pages, what is the number of pages of poetry? a ) 60, b ) 50, c ) 37, d ) 48, e ) 44<n>Output: c) 60, prose is 44*15.3/17.2 = ~ 42 pages and other is 44*5.3/19.2 + ~12 pages. so the number of pages of prose is 48. So 48 - 60 = ~12. So ~ 42 - 12 = ~30pages for other.<n><n>Input: In the figure, which two angles are complementary? a ) $23^\circ$, $7^{circ}$ b ) $27^\circ$, $14^{circ}$ c ) $17^{circ}$, $24^{circ}$ d ) $35^{circ}, 258^{circ}$ e ) $57^\circ$, no pair is complementary<n>Output: c. 23 and 114 are complementary. They are on the same side of the transversal, so 23 is vertical to 114 and 17 is vertical to 258, so they are vertical. So the answer is c.<n><n>Input: One pair of angles is supplementary. Which pair(s)? a ) 49Â° and 76Â° b ) 54Â° and 75Â° c ) 54Â°, 75Â° and 80Â°, 90Â° d ) 60Â° and 97Â° e ) 60Â°, 97Â° and 110Â°, 80Â°<n>Output: 60 and 97 degrees<n><n>Input: Find and complete the formula. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? (from wikipedia)"<n>So the final answer given by the solution is: "e"<n><n>Input: The number 7 is the only odd number in which the number of times the digit 1 appears is equal to the number of times the number 3 appears. True or False<n>Output: "The digit 3 appears twice in 7 i.e. at 3rd place and 7th place. So number of instances in which 3 appears is 2 + 1 = 3. The digit 1 appears twice too. Hence the answer is true."<n><n>Input: 5 / 3 / 12 / 11 =?<n>Output: "If we substitute the value of 5 and 3 in 12 / 6 then the L.H.S. will simplify to 2 / 2, then this expression can be written as 2 / 2 = 1 i.e. 12 - 6 = 6, then our answer is equal to 12 ( 6 - 12 ) = 6. "<n><n>Input: If the temperature and humidity are 70 and 68% and 100 and 100% respectively, what is the dew point?<n>Output: "The difference between temperature and dew point = 70 - 40 = 30. The required temperature is the same (30 oC) multiplied by the difference between humidity and dew point, i.e. ( 68-40 ) / 30 = 8 / 30 =.267 or.267 * 30 = 30 + 30 = 90<n>Answer = 90"<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The artist didn't use many colors to capture the view, he was famous for his very plain what? Choices:  A: landscape B: east side C: countryside D: middle america E: georgia<n>Output:		"georgia is the answer."<n>So the final answer to the above question is E<n>Input: The following are the questions of a survey : If Ajay has watched T-20 for 60 minutes, how many will not watch T-20 at all? If Amit watched T-20 during entire day, how many will watch T-20 for more time than Ajay? Out of 1200 who are watching T-20, how many are students? No of students are 100, How many are students and watching T-20 at once?<n>Output: a = students, =60 -> 1200 â students = 1130 â students = 520. c = students, â, = students -> 120 and 520 students are watching television > number of students and watching tv = a + c + (2a + b + 2c) = 250 â 810 â (2 * 520 + 6 * 60) = -240 students<n>Answer: a) 60 â 3 â 08 = 21 students are watching T-2 for the time being b) 60 â -810 - 450 = -1158 students are watching t-20 for 12 hours c) 08 â 093 â 510 + 1920 = 410 students are watching both i.e. tv and t-20 for at least one hour<n><n>This is an example of coding interview
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:When you experience boredom, what can you do on television? Choices:  A: watch film B: play cards C: play chess D: read news papers E: surf net<n>Output:		 C<n>So the final answer should be<n><n>Input:What can you do in your home alone? Choices:  A :watch movie B: Read book C: read newspaper D: call your friends E: search information on internet<n>Output:  B<n>So the final answer will be<n>Choice B.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:It had a beach with shallow water, while not the ocean this was a hot spot all the locals enjoyed on the what? Choices:  A: swimming pool B: pond C: lake D: bathe in E: childrens pool<n>Output:		"It had a beach "<n>So the answer is b<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What would happen to you if you are not good at playing violin? Choices:  A: happiness B: relaxation C: create music D: sadness E: loud noises<n>Output:		A : Answer given : A & B = > happiness + relaxation = creation of music Hence A&B should occur<n><n>Input: The solution to division of 26 by - 3 is 9. The remainder is?<n>Output: Reminder given is C (0)<n><n>Input: Solve for x 3 5 - 4 = 16 + 8 2x + x = 0<n>Output: 3rd degree equation<n><n>Input: The sum of four consecutive integers is 28. What is the last term of the series?<n>Output: 280 as last term<n><n>Input: Choose the odd man out: Tables. Pillow. Tablecloth.<n>Output: Cushion<n><n>Input: Chooses the odd man out: Desk. Pillow. Chair.<n>Output: Notebook<n><n>Input: Choice the odd man out: Books. Pencil holder. Books.<n>Output: Books<n><n>Input: Choices the odd man out - - - - - 9 / 12<n>Output: Not a ratio<n><n>Input: A certain number, when divided by 3, leaves the remainder 1. When divided by 5, it leaves the remainder 3. When divided by 7, it leaves the remainder -1. What is the number?<n>Output: (3 * 3) - 1 = 21<n><n>Input: Solving for x 3x - 4 = 4<n>Output: x = 2<n><n>Input: A cube 2 cm across is painted in eight different colors. How many distinct colors appear on the faces of the cube?<n>Output: 72<n><n>Input: In a survey of 350 students, 163 like math, 241 like art, and 102 like both math and art. If a student prefers both math and art, how many students are found in the survey?<n>Output: 241 * 239 / 350<n><n>Input: The question : "What is more important to you, A or B? " may be answered as <n><n>- A<n><n>- B<n><n>- Both<n><n>- Neither<n><n>Output: CORRECT answer is "Both"<n><n>Input: 4a -3b = 6c + 8d 7e
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What place would a person go to look at zebras? Choices:  A: zoo B: museum C: hospital D: desk E: opera<n>Output:		"we need someone to answer this. A is more correct and B is not even correct. if he wants to go to look at animals in the zoo. He will go to zoological park ( zoo ), if he wants to look at articfices in the museum he will go to museum "<n>So the final answer should be A or B<n><n>Input:if we say a = 1. b = 2. c = 3. d = 4. how many letters in English alphabet are less than d? Choices: A: 27 B: 25 C: 22 D: 17 E: 24<n>Output: "as we know first 10 numbers are less than d, hence the answer is 27. "<n>So the final option should be A<n><n>Input:What goes, "Peee-pee"? Choices:  A. Pianist. B. Piano. C. Parrot. D: Peach. E: Petunia<n>Output: "i think it is pianist. i don't want to answer this unless we know the real thing "<n>So the final choose should be A<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>#### Instructions: If you know what the correct answer is, please choose the same answer for each test.<n><n>Test 1<n><n>A number is chosen at random from the range of numbers 1 to 100. What is the probability the number chosen is even?<n><n>A. 50%<n><n>B. 0%<n><n>C. 25%<n><n>D. 20%<n><n>E. 75%<n><n>Answer: Option E. In every given set there is always a 33% probability that something is even.<n><n>Test 2<n><n>The average number of days in a week is 7. You've been given one number and asked to use the number to find the number of days in that week.<n><n>Average = 3 - A * Weeks = (Weeks * Average) + A<n><n>The number you were given was 73. How did you find your answer?<n><n>A. (52 * 73) + 73 = 3841<n><n>B. (49 * 73) - 49 = 3
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where might a human sit for extended periods over a bowl of water? Choices:  A: bathroom B: solar system C: coffee shop D: space shuttle E: airport<n>Output:		A<n><n>---<n>### Instruction : Answer all the questions.<n><n>Input 1:A farmer buys 120 eggs for $1.20. He lays a hen for each egg. After a year, how many hens does he have?<n>Answer: 120 eggs * 1 hen/egg = $1.20 / 1 hen/eghg = 120 hens<n><n>Input 2: A farmer can buy 10 apples or 3 oranges for 35 cents. Which is the better buy?<n>Answer: 3 oranges are better - apple prices are higher, and oranges have more calories<n><n>Input 3: A man sells his home for $270,000 and buys it back for $260,000. His wife asks, "How could you lose $10,000?". The man replied: "That's easy. I sold it, rolled the proceeds and bought it back." In terms of his wealth, was he richer or poorer?<n>Answer: Poorer. You need more money to buy the house then what you did sell the house for. He has a loss of $10k not including taxes, etc.<n><n>Input 4: A plane with a certain cargo takes off in Philadelphia, is refueled in Washington, then flows on to Chicago without landing. How much fuel was consumed by the plane?<n>Answer: Half a tank of fuel. The plane does not necessarily use the same amount of fuel for one complete trip. It could also land in Chicago and refuel from the half a tank it filled then continue on.<n><n>Input 5: There is a 2-seated bike. The first seat holds person A(30 Kg) and B(150 Kg). The second seat holds person C (30 Kg).The person on the second seat pushes the bike. What is the total friction exerted by the bike with a load of 280kg if its mass is 3.5 kg?<n>Answer: I need to look at this again. I think it's more complicated than simple math.<n><n>---<n>## Instructions : Read each question carefully and answer them in a clear and concise manner.<n><n>Q
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? A person is said to be honest when he or she always tells the truth. True or false? Choices:A. False B. True C. May be true D. May be false E. Itâs hard to determine<n>Output:True. The definition is a bit of an exaggeration. To tell the truth is not necessarily to be honest all the time. A person may tell the truth most of the time, in which case the person is honest more often than not, i.e. the person is honest a lot of the time. The definition is also flawed because, for a person to always tell the truth, the honesty would be to tell the truth all the time. The opposite is almost as true.<n>In general, a person is said to be reliable when the person tells the truth most of the times. The reliability would be to tell truth most of the times, so that the personâs honesty is based and guaranteed by the reliably to tell the truth.<n><n>Input:What is the correct definition of dishonesty? A. To make a statement without any intention to be truthful or honest. B. To tell some truthful thing but to do it wrongly or in a way deemed offensive to your audience. C. To tell the truth but to do it in an unclear, complicated, or distracting way. D. To fail to tell the truth, especially in some context that obliges one to do so. E. To be disingenuous, i.e. to not mean what a person says or does but being intentional in appearing to mean so that one can trick other people.<n>Output:True. A person is said dishonest if his statement or behaviour makes him or her to be regarded as a liar (i.e. a person who always or often lies). A âliarâ is the most obvious example of a dishonest person.<n><n>Input:B. A liar is someone who is always dishonest. True or false. Choices: B. True C. True, under specific circumstances D. False E. May be true<n>Output:False, i.e. it is NOT true that a liar is someone who always or often lies. A âliarâ could be

a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The police man was waving flares, what did he do with the impatient car? Choices:  A: book robber B: he had a word with the driver. C: believe guilty D: direct traffic E: wave on<n>Output:		A: book robber 6, 3, 2, 13, 16, 16,19 --> 13= 3.79 -> A<n><n>input: You are on your way to a picnic. You walk in the evening from your house to the parking lot in 60 minutes. You are at the parking lot in exactly 15 minutes. But your car was parked in the office during afternoon and you do not remember the parking space number. The area of the parking lot is 40 square meters. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where do you watch garbage? Choices:  A: television B: dumpster C: landfill D: fox news E: trashcan<n>Output:		"i watch bb<n> <n>The first thing to do in C++ is tell the computer which language you are using. C++ is what we call a compiler-based language. That means, unlike Javascript or HTML, the code needs to be compiled before being used. So before you type anything, you need to tell the computer that the program you want to create will be written in C++.<n>We need to tell the computer a bit more. The computer does not know what 'hello world' means - all it does is tell you exactly which characters need to be typed on the keyboard. That is exactly why you need to specify which characters you are expecting as the result from running a program. So in C++, we not only need to specify the language the program will be written in, but also the information about the output we expect. This is done by using a header file called `iostream`:<n>```cpp<n>#include <iostream><n>```<n>That is exactly 31 characters long which is 74 for C++ including the space characters.<n>When coding (type-writing if you will) a program in C++, it's very important not to get confused about whitespace (spaces, new lines, tabs).<n><n>All whitespace and spaces in C++ are important. So when typing a C++ program on the computer, the rules for whitespace are quite strict and are enforced by the compiler.<n><n>Let's go back to `hello world` for a second, which you will need to type manually in C++. Remember the spaces?<n>```cpp<n>Hello world<n><n>```<n>The compiler will treat the spaces as new lines for program execution. It's an extra step that it takes after the program has successfully been compiled. The idea is to make the program human-readable so users can see how a computer goes about interpreting and running their program.<n><n>Whitespace is more strict in C++ than in C. In fact, this is one of the things that make these two programming languages different.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>You may type the answer using a space and a. and an equal sign.<n>Example : A B C. D. DD.<n><n>### Output<n>A. B C:D D:D<n><n>A. B C D:D:D<n><n>A BC:D:D:D<n>\end{code}<n><n>Comment: Try reading your code

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:The man needed flooring, where was he looking to install it? Choices:  A: loft B: home depot C: house D: tiles E: carpet store<n>Output:		Option C<n>So the final answer was option C<n><n>Input:The bus went around the circular track 8 times.How many miles did it travel? Choices: 1 mile 2 miles 1/2 mile 12 miles<n>Output: Option 2<n>So the final answer option 2 for miles<n><n>Input: The man needed flooring,where was he looking to install? Choices: A: loft B :home depot C : house D :tiles E : carpet store<n>Output : Option C<n>So the answer is option C<n><n>Input : The bus went around the circular tracks 8 times How many miles did it travel? Choices 1 mile 2 mile s /2 mile 12mile<n>Output : Option 2<n>So final answer is option 2<n><n>Input : The man needed flooring,where was he looking to,install?<n>Choices : A :loft B : home dependent <n>C :house D :tile E : carpet store <n>Output : Option C.<n>So the final answer<n><n>Input : The Man needed flooring,wherewas he,looking to,install?<n>Answer : The man needed flooreint,wherewas he looking to,home depot in options B C E<n>Output : Option B. <n>So final answer is Option B<n><n>input : The fishing boat floated at an average rate of 3/5thth miles per hour,for six hours. 2 hours after the boat reached the destination,it left again for an other destination. The boat traveled back again at the same average rate. How far away was the boat at this time?<n>Output answer : Option E<n>So the final answer to this question is Option E<n><n>Input : A group of students were on a 112 mile journey, by plane and boat. The plane traveled 1/3rd of the journey  and it went on a 195 mile journey . The boat traveld 23 miles for 2 and 3/5 hours ,and 1/9th the<n>distance of the total journey for the remaining 4and 1/2 hours. Then, how much of the 112 mile  journey was travelled by boat?<n>Output: 7/5 <n>So final answer<n><n>\<n><n>input : The man needed floorer ,wherewas he
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:Where can you find pamphlets regarding diseases and ailments? Choices:  A: theaters B: health department C: library D: drawer E: mail box<n>Output:		pamphlets regarding diseasse and ailments are found in library only.<n>So the final answer of multiple choice question is B.<n><n>Input:How many years in total was there in the 20th century? Choices: A: 100 B: 110 C: 120 D: 200 E: none<n>Output: It was two centuries i.e., 100 years<n>So the final answer will be E.<n><n>Input:What will come next in sequence: 5, 10, 6, 3, 8, 2,? Choices: 1,6, 3,7, 10,8<n>Output: 9, 5, 0, 2, -1, -2, -4<n>So the final answer to this multiple choice question will be C.<n><n>Input:Raviâs salary is Rs 2273 and he gives 10% of it to charity, and a 5% of his salary to his father. So, how much money does Ravi have left? Choices:  none, 1245, 2105, 2310, 933<n>Output: Ravi has 897 remaining as per the scenario.<n>So the final answe to this multiple choice question is F.<n><n>Input:There are 19 persons in a room. How much time it took to close the door completely? Choices: A-6,B-248, C-75, D-15, 2<n>Output: The answer is 42 if the door is wooden and B if metal door is used.<n>So the final answere to this question choice will be C.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: in a recent head - to - head run - off election, 12000 absentee ballets were cast. 1 / 6 of the absentee ballets were thrown out and 3 / 5 of the remaining absentee ballets were cast for candidate a. how many absentee votes did candidate b receive? a ) 2,000, b ) 3,000, c ) 4,000, d ) 8,000, e ) 9,000<n>Output: 5 / 6 * 2 / 5 ( total absentee votes ) = 1 / 3 ( total votes ) = 1 / 3 * 12000 = 4000 answer is c<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the total age of a and b is 11 years more than the total age of b and c. c is how many years younger than a.? a ) 16, b ) 12, c ) 11, d ) 20, e ) 10<n>Output: "( a + b ) - ( b - c ) = 11 a - c = 11 answer is c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: the scoring system in a certain football competition goes as follows : 3 points for victory, 1 point for a draw, and 0 points for defeat. each team plays 20 matches. if a team scored 14 points after 5 games, what is the least number of the remaining matches it has to win to reach the 40 - point mark by the end of the tournament? a ) 6, b ) 7, c ) 8, d ) 9, e ) 10<n>Output: "to get 40 points as end of season we need another 26 points or more from remaining 15 matches : option a = 6 * 3 + 9 * 1 = 27 hence option a - 6"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: how much water should be added to 10 liters of a 20 % - solution of alcohol to reduce the concentration of alcohol in the solution by 75 %? a ) 25 liters, b ) 27 liters, c ) 30 liters, d ) 32 liters, e ) 35 liters<n>Output: "let x ltr water to be added 2 ltr alcohol to be represented as ( 20 ( 1 - 3 / 4 ( new soln. = 10 + x ) ) ) 2 = 5 % * ( 10 + x ) - - - - - - - - > x = 30 answer : c"<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input: a goods train runs at the speed of 72 kmph and crosses a 250 m long platform in 36 seconds. what is the length of the goods train? a ) 470 m, b ) 240 m, c ) 260 m, d ) 270 m, e ) none of these<n>Output: "explanation : speed = [ 72 x ( 5 / 18 ) ] m / sec = 20 m / sec. time = 36 sec. let the length of the train be x metres. then, [ ( x + 250 ) / 36 ] = 20 = > x + 250 = 720 = > x = 470. answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: the volume of a cube is 1728 cc. find its surface. a ) 864, b ) 556, c ) 255, d ) 287, e ) 267<n>Output: "a 3 = 1728 = > a = 12 6 a 2 = 6 * 12 * 12 = 864 answer : a"<n>So the final answer is a<n><n>Input: a certain drink of type a is prepared by mixing 4 parts milk with 3 parts fruit juice. another drink of type b is prepared by mixing 4 parts of fruit juice and 3 parts of milk. how many liters of fruit juice must be added to 63 liters of drink a to convert it to drink b? a ) 7, b ) 14, c ) 21, d ) 28, e ) 35<n>Output: "in 63 liters of drink a, there are 36 liters of milk and 27 liters of juice. with 36 liters of milk, we need a total of 48 liters of juice to make drink b. we need to add 21 liters of juice. the answer is c."<n>So the final answer is c<n><n>Input:What would humans do when their legs are tired? Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n>Output:		A is wrong because sitting does not tire legs, therefore excreting is the only logical option<n>So the final answer for Q59 is E<n><n>---<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question below.<n><n>How many years will a sum of â¹1000 grow to in 10 years compounded at the rate of interest 11% per annum if the interest is compounded annually?<n><n>Input: 10,689 answer: b if interest compound annually then after compounding of 1 year it should be (1000)1, after compounding of 2nd year it should be ((1000) 1)2 = 10002 after compounding of 3rd year it should be (( 1000 2) 3) = 100(10002)3 / (10003)^(1/3) = 111000 so it will take only 11 years to complete the given sum.<n><n>---<n><n>Output:<n><n>Let n be the number of years and a be the amount then we get a=(1-r)^n/1-r=1000Ã(1-11/100)^10/1-11/400000=[(1-11)/100]^10/1-7/333=11100<n><n>---<n><n>---<n><n><n><n>--- <n>
